188501.name: Harbour Monitor
188501.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is an early example of a small harbour monitor.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

188502.name: Form on Admiral's Wake
188502.description:
Form on Admiral's Wake is a quick-playing miniatures game of fleet naval battle during the age of sailing warships. It allows for the play of larger naval battles with a small number of players who will each control one or more squadrons of ships. The game is typically played with miniatures on a hex grid.

The game system uses an action deck to determine which ships can activate and what actions they can perform. The action cards have limitations based on a ship's fleet, sail state, wind orientation, crew quality, and damage level. The more favorable the condition and status of a ship, the more cards it will activate on.

One card is flipped each turn and ships that meet the requirements of the card may perform actions as indicated in the instructions. The actions allowed vary by card, but include moving one hex, sideslipping one hex, turning in a hex, and reloading cannons. Once fired, cannons require two actions to reload.

After all actions from the flip of a card are completed, all ships with loaded cannons may fire simultaneously. As a ship takes damage, its status reduces from undamaged to disabled to crippled. As the status changes, the ship will have less chances to activate.

Additional rules cover critical hits, grappling, fires, forts, anchoring, and fire ships.

188503.name: 5E Race: Arboreans
188503.description:
From publisher blurb:

Benevolent Gods of the Forest

Arboreans are a race of immortal, sentient plants that can seed human-shaped Sprouts with their memories to act as their avatars in the world.
With duties ranging from collecting information as simple tourists to dire missions to protect their forest homes, the Sprouts adventure forth before returning to their home to upload their memories & consider remerging with the Tree.
At once newborn yet ancient, motheringly gentle yet indomitably strong, innocent yet possessed of godlike wisdom, Arboreans are creatures of intriguing self contradiction.

The Arboreans are a new race for your fifth edition character, including:

A completely detailed race of plant-people with a new twist
7 new feats anyone can use
& 3 subraces: the proud Oukken, the rosey Romarins, & the wild Vigne Arboreans

188504.name: Norse
188504.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even the Vikings Fear Them!

Mythic Monsters: Norse brings you a dozen and one mythological monsters from the frozen shores of Scandinavia! Norse myths and legends are some of the foundational stories of the fantasy RPG tradition, going back to Tolkien and beforehand. The dwarves, elves, giants, and trolls of Norse myth and legend are at the heart of our myths and monsters, but they are just the beginning of an epic legendarium of creatures. From the scions of glorious Valhalla to the miserable pits of Hel, the blazing furnace of Muspelheim to the mountain realms of the Jotuns, the Nine Worlds are a place rife with adventure and danger always ready to menace the mortals of Midgard! From CR 5 to 30, we bring you an assortment of amazing adversaries for your heroes, starting with a swarm of linnorms, the serpentine primeval dragons that lurk in the wildest reaches of the lands where civilization is but a rumor. From the magma-mouthed crag linnorm to the bitter brumal bite of the ice linnorm, from the boreal forest fastnesses where the taiga linnorm lurks to the deep, dark waters where fjord linnorms prowl, these dragons leave dread in their wake, though perhaps none more so than the corpse-tearing cairn linnorm and the terrifying two-headed tarn linnorm. Fey spirits are likewise common in Nordic tales, with fossegrim waterfall spirits beguiling with their magical music and golden glamour to shadowy svartalfar inveigling mortals with their dark beauty while the hidden huldra simply seek to blend in with mortal society in hopes of finding a mate. The spirits of Asgard itself are represented as well, from the fallen einherji warriors to the valkyries that choose the slain and the wise and mysterious norns that judge them all. As if a dozen existing monsters were not enough, the fearsome Fenris wolf joins his brother Jormungandr the Midgard Serpent (from Mythic Monsters: Colossal) as a CR 30 menace whose hunger is endless and whose jaws span wide to devour the sun along with all life and hope. This book also contains mythic templates to bring the Nordic tropes of the Jotun thane, runecaster, and tricksome traveler to your creatures, along with additional rules for integrating mythic linnorms into your campaign!

188505.name: The Fires of Skinspeake
188505.description:
From drivethrurpg:

The Fires of Skinspeake is the first offering from brand-new Scottish RPG Publishers, X'I Publications. A 16 page OGL adventure for low level characters, easily adapted to fit any D20 Fantasy Ruleset, it introduces the remote island of Skinspeake and its inhabitants.

For generations life in the harsh environment of Skinspeake has relied on a simple exchange system. The humans in the town of Stormshelter catch fish and trade their surplus for dwarven coal. Recently though, deliveries from the Bronzehammer clan have ceased and the dwarves are staying tight-lipped as to why. With winter fast approaching, it's down to the party to save the residents of Stormshelter from freezing to death by relighting The Fires of Skinspeake.

The small island of Skinspeake has been designed in such a way that it can be easily slotted into any existing campaign world. It might be little, but it's jam-packed with colourful characters and can easily be used as a base for further adventures. Look out for more adventures set on the island coming soon - there's a lot more to the place than meets the eye.

188506.name: Meeple Monthly (Issue 35 - Nov 2015)
188506.description:
Meeple Monthly
Issue 35
November 2015

7 Wonders: Duel
Bezier's One Night Ultimate Vampire
My Little Pony: A Whole New Block of Ponies
Report from 2015 Speil
FUSE: This Game Will Self Destruct in 10 Minutes!

188509.name: Robbers of the Sea (Text)
188509.description:
From the introduction:

It is March 19, 1342 (First Tuesday After the Passion, 16 Edward III). The characters are natives of the city of Great Yarmouth (Magna Jernemuth) on the eastern coast of Norfolk. Edward III is King of England, and although the economy is unstable because of the war in France, the Norfolk coast is kept prosperous by active merchants who are involved in trade, smuggling and even piracy.

User summary:

This text-only adventure was published on the internet in 1991. It was intended for use with the Ysgarth, To Challenge Tomorrow, or Advanced Dungeons & Dragons games but could be easily adapted to nearly any role-playing system. The adventure was re-worked and re-published in 2002 for the Oroborus game.

188510.name: Footprints (Issue 23 - Sep 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Basic Equipage and Supplies: Cost and Encumbrances
Centaurs! More Than Just Horsing Around
Human and Halfling Character Background Tables
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
188510.description:
Footprints Magazine
Ideas and Adventures for Advanced Fantasy Gaming
Issue 23
September 2015

188511.name: Rap Wars
188511.description:
The game is essentially a modified deck of traditional playing cards, but featuring cartoon parodies of popular rap artists.

Each player is dealt a hand of 12 cards from the deck, and a game lasts 12 rounds. The player to the left of the dealer goes first.

Each round the top card of the deck is revealed, and the color of that card becomes the "trump" color. Each player plays a card from their hand of the trump color if they can. If the player does not have a card in the trump color he may play any card. The round ends when each player has played a card. If trump colored cards have been played, then the highest trump colored card played that round wins. If no trump colored cards were played, then the highest card of any color wins.

The winner of the round scores 10 points. The first player to score 187 points or higher is the winner of the game.

(It should be noted that, since a game only lasts 12 rounds and players only score 10 points for a round, it is impossible to score the required number of points in a game to win)

188512.description:
This was the last expansion published by Daedalus. Lots of cards for the Dragons and Architects of the Flesh, as well as the Jammers, finally making them a viable faction to use.

From the booster package: "The Architects of the Flesh are raising a sinister Arcanotower in the South American jungle - and it's up to the kung fu-kicking, gun-toting Dragons to save the day! More than 140 new cards, plus bonus info cards with background notes, Q&A, and extra goodies! The war is on - and the jungle explodes with action!"
188512.name: Shadowfist: Flashpoint

188514.name: Miser's Hoard (Issue 1 - Aug 1982)
188514.description:
Miser's Hoard
Issue 1
August/September 1982

Wondrous Pouch D&D Adventure
Trapped Rooms
Dungeon Master's Guide

188515.name: Miser's Hoard (Issue 6 - Sep 1983)
rpgissuearticle: I Wonder What Was In That Note...?

188516.description:
You are investigating alien ruins on Mars. Just as you are getting ready to take all the artifacts back to your ship, disaster strikes! A meteor storm sweeps across the planet! Your equipment is damaged! Your oxygen is running low! And to top it off the dust kicked up by the meteors has obscured the location of your ship!

What had been days worth of air is now only a few scant hours. You have to make it back to your spaceship - but what about all the artifacts you have already found? Decide what to take and what to leave, but remember, if you take too much, you run out of oxygen faster!

The game is played by moving your character across the barren Martian landscape, exploring tiles, attempting to find any Martian artifacts, more air, and most importantly, your ship. Your spacesuit has three randomly selected abilities that can help your character navigate the hostile terrain. Abilities which come into play when Event cards are drawn after moving.

The player only wins when:

The player does not run out of air.
The player finds the spaceship.
The player has at least one alien artifact upon reaching the spaceship.




The Mars Exploration mission fails if no items from the Martian Ruins make it back to Earth.

This was an entry in the 2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest. It won first place for:

Best Large Game
Best Thematic Game
Best Greyscale Printed Game
188516.name: Everything Except Air

188517.name: Ultimate NES Remix
188517.description:
Take on a rapid-fire onslaught of challenges and mash-ups from 16 of Nintendo’s finest 8-bit games! Test your skills on a gauntlet of quick, tricky challenges and remix stages that combine parts of different games. The best mix of titles from the NES™ Remix and NES™ Remix 2 games is on Nintendo 3DS. Now you’re playing with PORTABLE power!

Link™ vs. Donkey Kong™! Kirby™ vs. Boo™! It’s mash-up mania in this celebration of all things NES™! Race through to earn stars on increasingly tough tasks, like beating Ridley from Metroid™ or making Princess Peach™ save herself! Compete in Championship Mode’s blitz of challenges from the Super Mario Bros., Super Mario Bros.™ 3, and Dr. Mario™ games, then compare scores with others in your region via online leaderboards*.

Features action-packed challenges from 16 classic 8-bit Nintendo games.

Dominate exciting chunks of retro Nintendo games from NES™ Remix, such as Super Mario Bros.™, The Legend of Zelda™, Excitebike™, and Donkey Kong™.

Challenges from NES™ Remix 2 include bite-sized chunks of Super Mario Bros.™ 3, Zelda II- The Adventure of Link™, Metroid™, Kid Icarus™, and Kirby’s Adventure™, among many others.

Test your skills in a series of altered 8-bit challenges and improve your times to unlock more challenges!

Take on 3 unique challenges from the Nintendo World Championships and Nintendo Campus Challenge, then check your score on online leaderboards* to see how you stack up.

Source: The Publisher Website.

188518.name: Valkyria: Azure Revolution
188518.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Azure Revolution is a spin-off of Valkyria Chronicles. A highly industrialized military empire oppresses the land and one small nation decides to fight back.

188519.name: The Temple of Heryshaf
188519.description:
In this game, the player adventures through the Temple of Heryshaf, the Ancient Egyptian god of Primordial Waters. The goal is to reach the apex of the temple - Heryshaf’s Inner Sanctum! But beware! For the temple is filled with traps, and the passageways are winding!

At the start of the game, choose one of the five cards at the base of the pyramid to start the path. Each turn take the token representing your character and move it onto a card. The token may only move to a new card if the room you are in has a path which leads to that card and the card you are moving to has a corresponding path. When you attempt to move to a new card, flip the card over and sees what effects are activated. There are both traps and helper cards you may find inside the temple. You may choose to backtrack, but if you do, one card on the board is discarded, and a new unknown card takes its place - which may help or hinder you later.

The player wins if they make it through the temple, avoiding the traps or disarming the traps, to arrive safely at Heryshaf's Inner Sanctum.

This game tied for first place in the 24 hour contest for September 2014.

188520.name: Better Me: The Game of Growth and Friendship
188520.description:
Better Me is totally new approach to relationships and personal development. It challenges people to take action to improve themselves and their life, and strengthens relationships by helping people understand each other in a deeper and more meaningful way.

The game brings up interesting topics that don't normally come up in daily conversation, allowing players to quickly learn about themselves and their fellow players. And all in an encouraging and fun atmosphere, with no pressure or judgment permitted. When was the last time you told a group of people about a past accomplishment that you're proud of, or had a game challenge you to write a thank you letter to a loved one?

Better Me also harnesses the power of accountability. Any player committing to an action must find an accountability partner to help make sure they follow they follow through on their commitment. Both players write down the action to be taken, and the target completion date on their game sheet. This accountability strategy is key to insuring that players take action and grow.

Players move around the game board and draw cards which prompt all sorts of positive action and discussion. Players race to fulfill each of their five life areas, heart, mind, body, people and tangibles. The game is won by the first player to "fulfill" (3 points) each of the five categories; heart, mind, body, people, and tangibles. Alternatively, the game may be played to a time limit, and if no player has fulfilled all categories by the end of the time limit, the player with the most total points is the winner.

It's a new and engaging way to improve yourself and your relationships with friends, family, and coworkers, all while having fun!

188522.name: Alba di Cthulhu
188522.description:
From the back of the book:
Il 15 Marzo 1937, gli Strani Eoni sono infine giunti. Il Grande Cthulhu è risorto dalle acque, assieme alla sua città, R'lyeh. Ovunque, nel mondo, esseri alieni e blasfemi hanno iniziato a strisciare sul suolo terrestre e a volare sotto un sole verdastro, per fare scempio dell'umanità.

English translation:
March 15, 1937, the Strange Aeons are finally arrived. Great Cthulhu rose from the water, along with his city, R'lyeh. Everywhere in the world, alien and blasphemous beings started to crawl on the earth's surface and fly under a greenish sun, to bring havoc to the mankind.

188523.name: Alba di Cthulhu: Mazzo da Gioco
188523.description:
From the back of the box:
Carte ufficiali di Alba di Cthulhu

English translation:
Alba di Cthulhu official cards

188524.description:
Casino grade poker chip replacements for paper money in Axis and Allies.

(From the Publisher)
"Show off your economic strength or intimidate and distract your opponents with a huge stack of these stylish and durable Industrial Production Chips. Each piece is a Casino quality, 10 gram, 39mm diameter x 3mm thick Ceramic poker chip"

Designed originally with Axis and Allies Anniversary Edition in mind using the same color scheme and values (green = 1 IPC, red = 5 IPC, blue = 10 IPC) as traditional Axis and Allies paper money. Useable with any version of Axis and Allies.
188524.name: Axis & Allies: Industrial Production Chips

188525.description: Die Feuermoore (The Fire Moors) is a blank map for Chada & Thorn, with a start, end, and two middle stages. The moors lie between the forest and the mountains on the island of Narkon. You may add your own movement values and effect icons to the paths on the map.
188525.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn – Die Feuermoore
boardgameexpansion: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn

188526.name: Yakitori
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #8 – Yakitori
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 70!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 71!!
188526.description:
Yakitori, the famed Japanese street food on skewers, is now a game in which players are skewering tiles, placing dice, and manipulating a fickle market to vie for the most Yen from hungry customers.

In the game, players roll dice, select from actions such as Cooking, Market, and Influence. Food tiles are bought, skewered, and sold at just the right time to net a healthy profit. Clever planning can pay off in this family-friendly game that will also intrigue seasoned gamers looking for a thinky game that integrates theme with mechanisms.

188527.name: Stramash
188527.description:
Stramash is a classic chase game where you have to get your "Laddies" round the board to the safety of your castle. You also need to stop your opponents. You do this by landing on your opponent's Laddie so they have to go back to their start. Remember, they are trying to do the same to you! You use one of the six cards in your hand to decide which move is best for you - is it time to get to safety or to get revenge? You decide.

Be prepared to be ruthless...while you all have loads of fun.

188529.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 85 - Nov 2015)
188529.description:
Bringing You Tomorrow . . . Today!

The future isn't some far-off wonderland; it encroaches on the present with every passing moment! This issue of Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - checks out skills, ideas, and tech from the not-too-distant future, whether it's a transhuman tomorrow, a cyberpunk society, or something even stranger. This issue features:


"Training for the Tech," a look at styles, skills, and developments for shootists in the near-future. Written by Transhuman Space line editor Phil Masters, this guide offers a plethora of new options for any TL9 campaign (including Transhuman Space).
"Remixing the Rocker," a discussion of music and musicians in near-future GURPS campaigns. Discover how to take tunes to the next level, winning fans, altering minds, and even healing through music!
"Cutting-Edge Armor Design," this month's Eidetic Memory from GURPS Ultra-Tech co-author David L. Pulver. Devise near-future GURPS armor from scratch, choosing your material, coverage, and protective ability. Selecting from ceramic nanocomposite, laser-ablative polymer, liquid armor, and many more, you'll never run out of new wares to wear!
"Free Falling," a guide to all things zero-G related in GURPS. Learn how the body reacts to environs without gravity, what you can and can't do, what character traits are useful, and even two new zero-G combat styles!
"The Perky L33t," an Appendix Z from frequent Pyramid contributor Christopher R. Rice that adds new perks to cyberpunk netrunners.


This issue also presents a vignette by Matt Riggsby set in the new Car Wars universe, a Random Thought Table that examines the future through the prism of the past, plus an Odds and Ends that contemplates forgery and goes behind the scenes with the stunning Brandon Moore cover. The cutting edge of GURPS is here, and it's looking sharp!

- Publisher's description

188530.name: Eye My Favorite Things
188530.description:
User summary
曖昧フェイバリットシングス (Eye My Favorite Things)

"The whole of my hand is full of your favorites."
Eye My Favorite Things is a new sensation communication game. In this game, the whole of your hand is made by your neighboring player.

The first edition has Japanese and English rules, but the game is language free in play.

Each player asks some topic of the next player, such as favorite movies, cartoons, animals, etc., and that neighboring player writes down their top five favorites on cards in sleeves. Behind these answers are hidden cards numbered from 1 to 5 and one non-favorite on a card numbered 0. These six cards are now your hand for playing tricks.

You don't know what card answer corresponds to what rank number, so you have to guess the next player's preferences and tendencies, and play one card based on your judgement of their tastes. Once cards are played to the trick, the hidden numbers are shown. Your neighbor's preference rank is the card's strength. Card 5 is highest, 0 is lowest, but if 5 and 0 appear in the same trick, 0 wins.

In short, understanding your neighbor is the key to winning the game.

Publisher's summary
「私の手札は、あなたの好きなもので出来ている。」
My cards are made by your favorite things.
曖昧フェイバリットシングスは自分の手札カードを隣のプレイヤーに作成してもらい、プレイする新感覚のコミュニケーションゲームです。
各自は隣の人に「好きな映画、漫画、動物」などの質問を出して、１～５位と興味のない０位のランキングをカードに書いてもらい、自分の手札にします。
ただし手元に来るときにはランキングの順位が分からなくなっている為、隣の人の好みや傾向考えてランキングを予測し、カードバトルに勝利しましょう。

188531.name: Beyonder
188531.description:
From the back of the book


Imagine with Us

imagine a world where humans share the power of sentience with nine other races. A world made up of six primal forces known as The Six Energies, where terrifying Undead roam the empty places where a great empire once stood against them. A world where sorcerers operate in secrecy to avoid destruction at the hands of The Guilds and where those same Guilds develop ever-newer, ever-better Energetic powers. A word this is, itself, alive, and whose heartbeat can mean the overthrow of kingdoms.

188532.name: Blight of Biel
188532.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blight of Biel is a standard “fetch” mission with a twist. After finishing one adventure the PCs head to Biel for some rest. Sadly upon arrival at the thorp they discover the community has “the fever”. Only one person in town has not gotten ill and she needs some ingredients for a cure. This mission will require a quick resolution or the gravedigger will be busy! Oh yea…this game is called Dungeons & Dragons for a reason!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for mid-level adventurers and a DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

188533.name: The Usual Suspects
rpgseries: Case Files of the Blue Book Detective Agency
188533.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a collection of police dispatches and calls that you can send you characters on. You can also have them happen upon them in progress. Just pick one and insert it into you current adventure.

188534.name: Cryptics of Porphyra
188534.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a patchwork world, where the lands themselves can make little sense, many have trouble in seeing how things fit in the world. Cryptics are those that see the pattern in all things, how they use this gift changes between the individuals.

Cryptics of Porphyra is packed with the patterns of the following:

6 new racial archetypes
New insights
New feats
New powers
New psionic items
And a special new material found on Porphyra

188535.name: Kyoui no heya: Geijutsu ni kakusareta allegory
188535.description:
User summary
驚異の部屋：芸術に隠されたアレゴリー (Kyoui no heya: Geijutsu ni kakusareta allegory) in English means 'Rooms of Wonder: Allegories hidden in the art'. The publisher also refers to it in German as Wunderkammer.

Allegories are symbolic items which are drawn in several Western paintings to imply an abstract or spiritual meaning.
In the game of Wunderkammer, you spot such symbolic items drawn in a Western painting, and collect corresponding item tiles in your room. When a certain number of them are collected in your room, you complete the painting and score one point.

When you collect an item tile from opponent's room, you have to give one item tile in exchange.

You should watch your painting precisely, and collect item tiles faster than your opponents. The player who completed most paintings wins the game.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは西洋絵画カードに描かれたシンボルを探し当て、該当するシンボルチップを他のプレイヤーよりも早く、自分の部屋に蒐集します。 しかし、蒐集するには自分の部屋のシンボルと、相手の部屋のシンボルを交換しなければなりません。 絵をよく見て、シンボルを奪い合いながら、たくさんの絵画カードを獲得したプレイヤーが勝者となります。

188536.name: Beast
188536.description:
The object of this arcade-like game is to survive through a number of levels while crushing the "beasts" (represented by the character ├┤) with the movable blocks. The H's are attracted to the player's position (represented by a "diamond-like" character ◄►) every move. The beginning levels have only the common beasts ("├┤"), however from level H and forth the more challenging "super-beasts" appear. These are represented by "╟╢". These "super-beasts" are harder to kill as they must be crushed against a static block. At level P the eggs are introduced, implying greater challenge. These enemies are dormant at the beginning of each level, but will in time hatch into a "hatched beast" (╬╬). These beasts are the hardest to kill, as they can also move blocks to crush the player. They can however be killed as easily as the regular beasts, against any object.

Source: Wikipedia, "Beast (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188537.name: Il Paese dei Balocchi
188537.description:
From the back of the book:
Il 6 Giugno 1944 il mondo sprofondò nel più oscuro degli inferni. Nel Giorno del Giudizio i Morti iniziarono la caccia contro il genere umano...
...ma in un altro luogo, dove regna la fantasia, coloro che sono burattini nel mondo dominato dai Morti, vivono la loro vita e le loro avventure. Qui troverete eroici cavalieri, orsi con buffi cappelli in testa, potenti streghe vendicative e graziose dame con i loro ombrellini di pizzo.

English translation:
On June 6, 1944, the world sank into the darkest of hells. On Judgment Day the Dead began hunting mankind ...
... but in another place, where immagination reigns, those who are puppets in the world dominated by Dead, live their lives and their adventures. Here you will find heroic knights, bears with funny hats on his head, powerful witches and graceful ladies with their parasols of lace.

188539.description:
Welcome those from other lands with their own place to stay in your city thanks to Dice City: Embassy, and gain the benefit of their knowledge and abilities.

Dice City: Embassy is a mini-expansion for Dice City that consists of three copies of the same card.
188539.name: Dice City: Embassy

188540.name: Tamar (Issue 1.1 - Jul 1998)
188540.description:
Tamar
For Enthusiasts of the Talislanta RPG

Issue 1.1
July 1998

188542.name: Sʌuriʌn
188542.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Explore a massive open world environment, recreated down to the leaf, based on the fossil record. Hell Creek will challenge your survival skills with unpredictable environmental hazards such as floods, fires, storms and dramatic seasonal changes. That’s without worrying about those with teeth and claws…

Source: The Game Website.

188543.name: RND (Issue 1 - Nov 2015)
rpgissuearticle: The Market Place in November, Encounters
The Temple through Time and Space

188544.name: Broken System (Issue 0 - Nov 2015)
rpgissuearticle: What is required to purify the host?

188546.name: Werk in Uitvoering
188546.description:
English:
This designing of this game was commissioned by the Dutch "Rijksgebouwendienst" (government building service). It is an attempt to make the changing in their organizational structure more transparent through a boardgame. During the game, player collect points by completing projects en cooperatively realizing the construction of a building. Completing projects is accomplished by negotiating with other players for the right "people". The game contains 6 types of people, each with their own special skills, represented by game chips.

Note: The game was published in order of a department of the Dutch government and was therefore only published in Dutch.

Dutch:
Dit spel is ontworpen in opdracht van de Rijksgebouwendienst. Het is een poging om het het kantelen van haar organisatie inzichtelijk maken middels een bordspel. In het spel moeten de spelers punten verdienen door projecten uit te voeren én gezamenlijk een gebouw te realiseren. Het uitvoeren van een project gebeurt door te onderhandelen met de andere spelers over de juiste mensen die moeten worden ingezet. Het spel bevat 6 type mensen, met verschillende capaciteiten, vertegenwoordigd door spel fiches.

188547.name: Maximum Apocalypse
188547.description:
Maximum Apocalypse is a cooperative roguelike adventure game for 1-6 players. In Maximum Apocalypse, civilization has already fallen. The players are survivors of the apocalypse whose mission is to survive the hostile landscape.

The game map is randomly generated and different every time that you play. On each turn, a player can use up to four actions to explore the map, play cards, equip weapons, scavenge for resources, draw cards or battle off monsters.

Picking a unique survivor class within the group, players must plan their strategy and work together while leaning on their survivor’s strengths in order to defeat monsters and avoid starvation. For example, the Fireman is deadly up close with his ax and can easily chop down monsters; meanwhile the stealthy Hunter is great at scouting the map and avoiding traps — but roaming monsters are gathering quickly and time is running out. If you are overwhelmed by monsters or die of starvation, the players lose. If they can find enough gas and get it back to their van to escape, they all win and live to play another scenario.

188548.name: Scrap
188548.description:
You are the captain of a crew of workers, abandoned by your superiors on the planet Rhodon V, which you once mined for resources. Now, a cargo ship has crash landed nearby and its crew has offered a ride off of the planet to anyone able to repair their ship – but you aren't the only one to respond to the distress beacon. Will you be the first player to collect all of the Repair Parts to fix the cargo ship and escape the planet?

The goal of Scrap is to be the first player to collect three different Repair Parts and deliver them back to the Start Area. Repair Parts can be collected by passing over specific spaces on the board or by looting them from your opponents after defeating them in battle.

Each player operates a unique vehicle, monstrous tank-like machines that have been constructed from salvaged mining and military equipment. Each vehicle starts with a special ability, different stats, and a set amount of upgrade slots. As players traverse the board, they will collect Resource Cards through different means, which are used to build upgrades, collect Unique Upgrades, trigger Events, and more.

188549.name: Brainstorm - a party game
188549.description:
Brainstorm, a party game is a game app for iOS and Android that rolls many favorite party games into one - with a few surprise categories as well! Played in two teams of any size, it is designed to keep players with all types of skill sets engaged.

9 Categories of On-Your-Toes Gameplay, with over 9,000 Challenges.

Act-it (charades) - One person acts out the clue for the rest of the team.
Guess-it (word clues) - Get your team to guess as many words as they can.
List-it (things in a category) - Teams try to guess the 9 answers in the category.
Draw-it (draw the clue) - Get your team to guess your drawing as quickly as they can.
Match-it (memory) - Find the pairs as quickly as you can, watch out for the moving tiles.
Perform-it (reverse charades) - The team acts out the clue for just one guesser.
Order-it (sorting challenge) - Put the listings in order...shortest to longest, oldest to newest.
Build-it (tangram torture!) - Use geometric shapes to build a picture of the clue.
Know-it (trivia challenge) - Guess as many trivia questions as you can before the buzzer.

Features:

9 categories of play with
Over 9,000 different challenges
Game play: Play all categories or select only your favorites
Game length: Select the number of rounds

Source: The Game Website.

188550.name: WRC 5: FIA World Rally Championship
188550.description:
WRC 5 is the official video game of the 2015 FIA World Rally Championship, featuring cars and rallies from the 2015 season, including support categories. This game featured British indie rock band Bastille's song "Pompeii" in its intro.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Rally_Championship_%28vi...:_FIA_World_Rally_Championship_.282015.29", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188551.name: Conquest of Elysium 4
188551.description:
User Summary

Conquest of Elysium 4 is a quick monster killing game.

188552.name: Let's Sing 2016
188552.description:
Grab your mic and sing your heart out! Featuring 35 chart hits from some of the world’s biggest artists, Let’s Sing gives you the stage to be the star you know you are! Play with friends and go head to head in Battle mode or put your talents together in Duet mode. With 7 exciting ways to play, the party never stops!

Source: The Developer Website.

188553.name: Circuit Breakers (2015)
188553.description:
User Summary

Weapon experts attempt to eliminate a dangerous mechanical menace.

188554.name: Stella Glow
videogamehonor: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Hero of the Year Nominee
2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Nominee
188554.description:
User Summary

The game centers around Alto and his childhood friend Lisette as they try to stop Hilda the Witch of Destruction.

188555.name: Artefakt (Issue 3 - 1993)
188555.description:
This issue contains adventures of the following RPG systems:

- Midgard (Drei Perlen für die Sonnengöttin)
- Call of Cthulhu (Project Resurrection)

Furthermore articles about the German conventions Spiel'92, FeenCon'93 and OST-Con'93 can be found.

188556.name: Artefakt (Issue 2 - 1992)
188556.description: This very slim issue contains only one Shadowrun-adventure (Störfall) a Blood Bowl review, a list of German gaming societies and reviews of German conventions.

188557.name: Letter Playing Cards
188557.description:
A high quality deck of playing cards made up of letters. With it, you can play hundreds of word games and card games. Instead of numbers, sets and runs, you use letters and make words.

Letter Playing Cards are for all ages. Whether you’re just starting out learning your letters and words in pre-school, or a scholar of the English language, fascinated by words. Whether you're a backpacker travelling light and meeting new friends, or a parent with too much luggage.

It's a whole new dimension on the phrase ‘Let’s have a game of cards’.

Here’s the short list of some of the more popular games you can play with Letter Playing Cards.

Word Poker; Texas Spell ‘Em; Rummy / Gin Rummy; Brag (3,4, 5 card or 9 card!); Patience / solo games; Hangman; Snaffle - the letter grab game; Old Maid; Murder (or Mafia); Word Black Jack; Letter Cheat; Word Speed or Spit; Go Fish; Hearts; Indian Word Poker; Moogle; Spoons; Letter Whist; Anagrams; Crosswords; Ghost; Flash Cards, Spelling tests, Word Bridge.

188558.name: Jenny LeClue
188558.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




The choices that the player makes throughout the game will have a profound impact. The game will contain point and click elements. The game features a hand drawn art style. The player will be able to interact with most items in the game. During dialogue sections, the player can observe the person talking to spot clues as to whether they are lying. Locations that the player will explore will include mines, graveyards, mountains, police stations and libraries.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jenny LeClue", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188559.name: Artefakt (Issue 1 - 1992)
188559.description:
Containing adventures of the following systems:

- Call of Cthulhu (Herbsterwachen)
- Star Wars (Ein feuchter Job)
- Shadowrun (Im Schatten der Zukunft)

Furthermore it contains articles about German conventions and a poem.

This issue was published shortly after the foundation of the gaming society "Förderkreis innovatives Spiel" (F.i.S e.V.).

boardgameimplementation: Lost Legacy: Binbo Tantei to Inbo no Shiro
boardgameintegration: Lost Legacy: Fourth Chronicle – The Werewolf & Undying Heart
Lost Legacy: Second Chronicle – Vorpal Sword & Whitegold Spire
Lost Legacy: Third Chronicle – Sacred Grail & Staff of Dragons
Lost Legacy: Fourth Chronicle – The Werewolf & Undying Heart
Lost Legacy: Second Chronicle – Vorpal Sword & Whitegold Spire
Lost Legacy: Third Chronicle – Sacred Grail & Staff of Dragons
188561.description:
In the distant past, a starship from a faraway world appeared in the sky. Damaged in battle, the craft broke apart and traced lines of fire across the horizon. These falling stars crashed to the surface, and in the ages to come, became enshrined in legends as the Lost Legacy. Discover where the Lost Legacy can be found and win the game!

Lost Legacy: Orb of Prophecy can be played independently or mixed together with other Lost Legacy sets to create a unique custom set. This version was released at AEG Big Game Night at GenCON 2015 and won't be sold for retail.

As for how to play, Lost Legacy is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. You start the game with one card in hand from a deck of sixteen cards. On a turn, you do the following:


Draw: Draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand.
Play: Choose one of the two cards in hand to play and place it face up in front of you.
Effect: Carry out the played card's effect, after which the card is considered as discarded.
End: Throughout gameplay you're trying to eliminate other players or uncover the location of the "Lost Legacy" card; this card might also be in the "Ruins", a location that holds one card at the start of the game and possibly acquires more cards during play. When someone discovers the Lost Legacy, the game ends, everyone tallies the value of the cards they've played and the card left in hand, and whoever has the highest total wins.



By combining different Lost Legacy sets (while keeping only a single Lost Legacy card in play), up to six players can compete at the same time.
188561.name: Lost Legacy: Orb of Prophecy

188562.name: Stygian (Issue 2 - Apr 2002)
rpgissuearticle: One Body Inhabited by Many Minds
Reviews You Can Use: Gaming Products
188562.description:
Stygian
Issue 2
April 2002

Madness
The Bad Sees - Insane PrC's
Venomous Vats: Psionics and Lunacy
Tome of Worlds: Inside the Mind of Madness
Undead and Madness
How to Roleplay Insanity

188563.name: Stygian (Issue 3 - Feb 2003)
188563.description:
Stygian
Issue 3
February 2003

The Perils of Nature

The cover page measures 22.44" x 17.35"; the remainder of the issue is standard letter size.

188564.name: UTOPIA 9 - A Volatile Vacation
188564.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

You play a guest on Utopia 9, a vacation planet. But when you arrive nothing is as promised.

188565.name: GOCCO OF WAR
188565.description:
User Summary

A futuristic playground where kids come together to play make-believe war — a tradition started almost a hundred years ago.

188567.name: Scourge of War: Waterloo
188567.description:
Scourge of War: Waterloo follows in the footsteps of its American Civil War predecessors and takes the action to one of the most famous battles in history. It is by far the most detailed game about the final battle of the War of the Seventh Coalition.

The game boasts 20 historical scenarios (from the French, Prussian and British perspectives), 3 multiplayer scenarios, unlimited user generated sandbox scenarios, and a sandbox campaign, which adds a campaign layer to the game providing more context for sandbox battles.

Source: The Game Website.

188568.name: 世界イセキ発見 (Discovery of World Ruins)
188568.description: In 世界イセキ発見 (Discovery of World Ruins), one player represents ancient people and places ruins secretly somewhere in a 5x5 grid. The other players are archaeologists and need to uncover the location of these ruins through reasoning and hints from the lost ancient people.

188570.name: Imbelnhi's Bestiary
188570.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Being a Traveler's Account of Our Continent and Her Creatures

Written by an in-game personage — Imbelhni, the zweyjen — and with comments by five famed historians, tacticians, and travelers, the bestiary contains information and game stats for over sixty different creatures for Moderators to use in their games.

188571.description:
Santa Guise is coming to town! He's decking the halls AND decking villains right and left! He has presents for all of his friends, but you can only unwrap them when he says it's OK, so you'd better be on his "Nice" list! And beware: if Guise is incapacitated, the dreaded Green Grosser will enact his latest plot, ushering in his War on Christmas!

Meanwhile, the heroes known as Bunker, Absolute Zero, and Unity are working to uncover the mystery behind the villain Chokepoint. How did she get so much power? And why was she locked up in a secret bunker in Fort Adamant? What is really going on here? Armed with some new tricks, the heroes have to get to the bottom of this, before it's too late...
188571.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: 2015 Holiday Promo Pack

188572.name: The Looney Tunes Show Run Tweety Run Game
188572.description: Basic spin and move game with Sylvester chasing Tweety around the board. Each player gets a Sylvester mover and tries to land on the Tweety mover. If the spinner lands on Run Tweety Run, Tweety moves from one birdcage to another. The first Sylvester to land on Tweety three times wins.

188573.name: 1WW: World War One in Europe
188573.description:
1WW: The First World War is a low complexity, highly abstracted, two-player game of the entire First World War in Europe that lasted from 1914-1918. The game is played on a single tabloid-sized map, and 140 half-inch playing pieces.

This mini-game is included in Issue #2 of Counterfact magazine.

Components:
One rulebook
One 11"x17" map
140 double-sided die-cut counters
One six-sided die is required to play (not included)

188575.description: Add-on to kickstarter campaign to randomly determine starting player.
188575.name: Canterbury: Saxon Meeple Die

188576.name: GG
188576.description:
GG is based on the idea of having a card game that is as easy as learning rock-paper-scissors, but more based on strategy, memory and deception.

Each player has an identical 32-deck of cards. Players use these cards to make 4 piles of 8 cards each to challenge each other.

Instead of challenging an opponent, strategy cards can be played.

The goal is to eliminate the rivals by attaining their GG cards.

188577.name: What is this?
188577.description:
The game consists of two packs of 30 cards. Each card has a picture on one side and a description on the other.
One pack of cards is spread out picture side up so that all pictures can be seen. The other pack is stacked picture side up. The game starts by turning over the top card of the stack so that the descritipion can be read. Somewhere amongst the pictures showing is the item matching this description but finding the match may not be as easy as it seems as the pictures have been chosen so as to appear to be something else and a little imagination may be needed to make the match. Whoever makes the match first takes both cards and then the next stack card is turned over and a new match has to be found. When all cards in the stack have been used, whoever has the most cards in the winner. The game rules state that it is for two players or teams but clearly any number can play.

188578.name: Dishaster
188578.description:
From the back of the game box

You've seen them do it at the circus, but can you keep the plates spinning on top of those tall skinny sticks? The action never stops in this video version of the big top. All you have to do is keep running back and forth as you try to balance the plates that just never seem to stop coming. And, if you're lucky, when they all seem to come crashing down you'll be able to catch them. After this game doing the dinner dishes will seem like childs play.

188579.name: Dancing Plate
188579.description:
From the back of the game box

Be careful, don’t broke these delicate Chinese china.

Would you like to try this traditional Chinese variety-dancing plate? Now it’s your turn! Have several plates revolve on the top of different wants and keep them all in balance. If any plate falls, rush to get it, otherwise, in case of breaking too many plates, it’s other’s turn again.

188580.name: PlatterMania
188580.description:
From the back of the game box

Take you place among the all-time-great circus performers. Test your skill as you perform amazing plate-balancing feats to rack up points!

Beginning with four spinning plates on top of four rods, speed and accuracy are crucial, as you move from one rod to the next spinning the plates. Play alone or with friends — a total of four players can compete!

As you move your control stick, your computer displays in fully animated color graphics, the busy circus performer and a table full of rods, with spinning plates on top.

Be careful not to spin a plate too hard or not enough —- you’ll be sorry when plates come crashing and clattering to the floor or fly off into the rafters!

Be alert and remember the order in which you first spun the plates; that’s the order in which they’ll fall!

As your skill improves, you can give an astounding performance, by increasing the number of rods and balancing up to 12 at any given time. The more plates you spin, the greater your score!

Keep your eyes open and be on your toes, as you dash from rod to rod picking up points — hope you reach them in time!

188581.name: Open, Sesame!
188581.description:
From the back of the game box

Open, Sesame! Have you ever been in dream of that mysterious and exotic world? Suppose you are the brave lucky man in ancient Arabia, Ali Baba, and now, you are on your way to the treasury up on the hilltop.

Go up and down, help yourself with ropes, you have to make your own way to escape from those keen guards. Taking the chance to get the magic ball, you may defeat every enemy you confront.

As long as you go through all the difficulties, you would hear the incredible magic sound Open, Sesame! and a world of imagination comes true…

188582.name: The Lost City
188582.description:
Grandma was right.

Nobody really believed her. Not even you, her favorite grandchild.

But she was right. And more so than you could ever imagine.

The city before you, deep in the mist shrouded forest, can't be found on any map. It shouldn't even exist. Though it's been asleep for a long time, you feel a mysterious power begin to awaken from the ruins around you.

Legend has it the civilization that built this place could somehow control the seasons. But nobody listens to legends.

Nobody except Grandma.

And she was right.

You look again at the artifact she gave you. Close to this lost city, it almost seems alive in your hand.

The city does exist. It's real.

Could the secret magic, powerful enough to change the seasons, be real too?

Source: The Developer Website.

188583.description:
Highwaymen is a 2-4 player tabletop game in which the Players take on the roles of a group of Highwaymen attempting to rob a coach travelling through a dangerous forest trail.

Players must work together to steal the gold from the coach but must be wary that at any moments their comrades could turn against them!

The game is played in 2 phases, firstly, the players take it in turn to take their actions, afterwards the Coach and Escorts will take their turn. A Player's turn can be taken in one of two ways, Players can either fire their pistols, or attempt to steal gold from another Player. If the player chooses to shoot, they shoot their pistols twice at the Escorts or the Coach, move up to 3D6 spaces, then shoot twice more. If the Player tries to steal, they roll 3D6 movement, and can attempt to steal from the first Player they come into contact with.

If an Escort takes damage it is removed from the board and if the Coach takes damage then it will drop coins. The Players can move over the Coins to add them to their collection, the winner of the game is the Player with the most coins at the end of the Game. The game ends when either the Coach leaves the woods (after 8 turns) or the Players destroy the Coach (when it has taken 20 hits).
188583.name: Highwaymen
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 021 – UK Games Expo 2016

188585.name: Lucius II
188585.description:
User Summary

This game follows up on the plot from the first. Lucius is taken to a psychiatric hospital and again starts to prey on victims. The character Lucius can be given special abilities and characteristics and skills.

188586.name: Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel 2: Vagrant Lands
188586.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Fallout Tactics 2 is a canceled sequel to Fallout Tactics: Brotherhood of Steel. Pre-production started shortly before the release of the first game, but it was canceled around December 2001.

188587.name: Van Buren
188587.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Van Buren was the codename given to what would have been Fallout 3, that was being developed by Black Isle Studios before the parent company, Interplay Entertainment, laid off the PC development team on December 8, 2003, effectively cancelling the game. Prior to its cancellation, Van Buren was set to carry on the Fallout series, but was not a sequel to Fallout 2. An official Fallout 3, unrelated to the abandoned Van Buren project, was developed by Bethesda Game Studios after Interplay sold the single-player rights to the franchise to Bethesda Softworks.

Although the complete story of Van Buren was never revealed, many important details were divulged prior to its cancellation.

The player's character would start the game as a prisoner; whether the character was wrongfully imprisoned or guilty was to be determined at character creation.

Source: Wikipedia, "Van Buren (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188588.name: Fallout Extreme
188588.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Fallout Extreme was a title in development for several months but was canceled due to a lack of a proper concept that could have been explored further.

188589.name: Fallout Online
188589.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Fallout Online was to be set in the Fallout universe. Interplay's rights to developing and publishing this game have been the subject of a legal dispute between Bethesda Softworks, the current owner of the Fallout franchise, and Interplay. An out-of-court settlement was reached in January 2012, in which Bethesda received full rights to the Fallout online game for two million dollars.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fallout Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188590.name: Shop with Barbie
188590.description:
Aim of the game: to help Barbie fill her wardrobe with new fashion accessories. Contents: Game board, 36 illustrated discs
4 Barbie playing pieces, 4 plastic bases, 2 handbag cards, 1 die & Game rules.

This is a combination Memory game & board game. Players start on the Barbie that matches their playing piece on the corner of the playing board. The discs of accessories are placed upside down in the middle of the board. Players roll & move around the board, turning over a disc to try to match the accessory they land on. If it matches, they keep it. If not, play passes to next player. If they land on a handbag square, they get one of the two handbags. If they land on a player square, they get to take a handbag from one of the other players. In order to win, they must get each accessory, get a handbag and return to their Barbie square.

188592.name: ABAE Football
188592.description:
Game published in Brazil in the 70's (probably 1970) by ABAE - Associação Brasileira de Alimentação Escolar (Brazilian Association for Nutrition in School) in order to collect funds for its activities.
It's a football game in which the ball is moved according to the result of a die roll. According to the rules, the match's duration is 10 minutes divided in two 5-minute halves.

188593.description:
This is the German version of the English promo card "Guardian of Strength" contained in Thunderstone: Promo Pack #2.

It is listed here separately because it was given out without the other two promos of that pack as well, for instance at Pegasus' booth at SPIEL Essen 2013.

The Wächter der Stärke has the following stats:

Health: 12
Gold Value: 2
Monster Type: Wächter
XP: 3
Victory Points: 7
Effect Text:
"Kann nur aus dem Dungeon entfernt werden, wenn er besiegt wird.
DURCHBRUCH: Auf Position 0 bewegen.
GLOBALER EFFEKT: Solange diese Karte auf Position 0 liegt, zerstöre jedes Mal die oberste Karte des Dorfstapels, nachdem davon eine Karte gekauft wurde.
KAMPF: Erhöhe die Lebenspunkte des Wächsters [sic, typo!] um die Summe der Stufen deiner aufgedeckten Helden."
188593.name: Thunderstone: Promokarte Wächter der Stärke

188594.name: Rainbow Warrior
videogameversion: English / European Atari ST 3.5" disk edition
188594.description:
From the back of the box:

A Native American prophecy tells that the peoples of the world will unite as Warriors of the Rainbow, to save the planet from destruction by greed and careless exploitation. The environmental pressure group Greenpeace was inspired by this to call its flagship Rainbow Warrior.

This game has been carefully compiled to reproduce six Greenpeace campaigns and one final campaign "The spirit of the Rainbow Warrior" dedicated to Fernando Pereira who died when the original Rainbow Warrior was sunk. This game is the first of its kind, designed to raise the consciousness of the environmental issues faced by the entire human race.


Seven Greenpeace campaigns from "Stop Acic Rain" to "Save the Whale".



Serious issues presented in an all action way.



Detailed information on the campaigns in an accompanying booklet.



Stunning Graphics.



Unique action photographs of actual campaigns.


... The individual can make a difference.

User Summary

Greenpeace is a activist environmental organisation formed in the late 60s and early 70s. By the late 80s, when this game was released, they had achieved a reputation for worldwide direct action, both legal and illegal.

Rainbow Warrior consists of seven levels, each depicting a different Greenpeace campaign. Each level has different gameplay, from attempting to block a pipe pumping out low-level nuclear waste, to destroying aerosol cans before they deplete the ozone layer.

188595.name: Cicero's Apple Bite Contest
188595.description: This game was published in Bugs Bunny's Trick 'n' Treat Halloween Fun #3 in 1955 by Dell. Cicero is Porky Pig's nephew. This is basically a board game version of the traditional party game where players try to bite an apple hanging from a string. The players race to be the first to finish "eating" their apples. Each player gets an illustration of an apple which is cut into 11 pieces. They then take turns drawing chits from a box; when the chit shows an apple, the player can remove a piece of their apple. If the chit shows a jack o'lantern, they've missed the apple and the game-play goes back to the other player.

188596.name: UNO: Disney Planes – Fire & Rescue!
188596.description: The fun spreads like wildfire with UNO Disney Planes: Fire & Rescue! Classic UNO rules apply, but the addition of a special rule and 4 extra cards gives players a chance to experience all new game changing moments! When you play a Water Drop Card, each blue card in your hand acts like water: empty them ALL into the discard pile like water from your tanks putting out a fire. Then you get to choose the next color to resume play! Fans of the film will recognize their favorite characters—like Dusty Crophopper, Skipper Riley and Blade Ranger—all of which are featured in true-to-movie detail on the cards they play. And do not forget to yell "UNO" when you only have one card left! Includes 112 cards and instructions.

188597.name: The Wrecker's Tower Game
188597.description:
(from the back of the book)

Holidaying on the Cornish coast, the Famous Five discover a peculiar light that flashes out to sea on dark and stormy nights. What could it be? Is it signalling to someone? The Five are determined to find out. And they want YOU to help them.

188598.name: The Haunted Railway Game
188598.description:
(from the back of the book)

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find a book and a selection of playing cards including a compass, binoculars, a map, a code book and a rucksack; and in case you need refreshment, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

188600.description: Published by Standard Comics in "Santa's Christmas Comics" in December, 1952. Simple race game where you use chits instead of dice to determine moves. Goal is to be the first to reach the end. Board shows several of Standard's funny animal characters in Christmas scenes, the most well-known being Supermouse, Spotty the Pup, and Buster Bunny, as they each had their own titles.
188600.name: Supermouse's Christmas Game

188601.description:
Spoilers is a party-trivia game with movie questions and bluffing mechanisms.

The player taking the spoiler role (a different one each turn) makes a question about what happens in a particular movie and gives three possible answers (A, B, C). The Spoiler knows the right answer and earns points when the other players answer incorrectly and loses points when they get it right. Thus, the Spoiler will try to mislead them (and everyone knows that). Everyone takes the role of Spoiler three times, then the player with the most points wins.

•••

Party Game con preguntas de cine y mecánicas de faroleo.

El jugador que toma el rol de Spoiler (uno diferente en cada turno) hace una pregunta acerca de lo que sucede en una película en particular y da tres respuestas posibles (A, B, C). El jugador Spoiler sabe cuál la respuesta correcta, pero sólo ganará puntos cuando el resto de jugadores fallen y perderá puntos cuando acierten, por lo que tratará de despistarlos (y todo el mundo lo sabe).

La partida dura tres rondas (cada jugador Spoiler hará 3 preguntas) y el jugador con más puntos al final, gana.
188601.name: Spoilers
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016

188603.name: Decopedia Volume 2
188603.description:
Author's description:

This second volume follows the pattern of the first and is designed to give the referee "drop ins" for their game. Each entry is separate and self contained so you can take it and squeeze it into your own game. Inside you will find:

10 Planets
10 Alien animals
10 People of Interest
10 Story seeds

70 pages giving the referee a bank of ideas to draw from.

188604.description:
The Fluctuating Market is an expansion for Rockwell.

From now the Rockwell stock exchange will fluctuate (the resource values are fixed in the basic rules), which will allow the prices of resources from the mine to rise or fall, which will require players to buy and sell at just the right moment. Enough to challenge even the most hardcore gamers!

This expansion includes a new Stock Exchange board and a new deck of 64 cards, both of which replace their counterparts in the base game.
188604.name: Rockwell: The Fluctuating Market

188606.name: Decadolo
188606.description: The players place their Othello-style tokens in a 10 x 10 grid, shuffle the cards and place them in a pile. The players then take turns drawing cards, which give instructions about flipping tokens over. A player's first goal is to change the color of an entire column of 10 tokens into their color. This column is then locked to the end of the game. The player with the most columns locked in their color is the winner. The game comes with 100 wooden tokens and 50 cards.

188607.name: Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiary 5
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
188607.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Beyond the veil!

Creatures strange beyond imagining and more terrifying than any nightmare lurk in the dark corners of the world and the weird realms beyond. Within this book, you'll find hundreds of monsters for use in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Face off against devils and dragons, deep ones and brain moles, robots and gremlins, and myriad other menaces! Yet not every creature needs to be an enemy, as whimsical liminal sprites, helpful moon dogs, and regal seilenoi all stand ready to aid you on your quests—if you prove yourself worthy.

Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 5 is the fifth indispensable volume of monsters for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and serves as a companion to the Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook and Pathfinder RPG Bestiary. This imaginative tabletop game builds upon more than 10 years of system development and an Open Playtest featuring more than 50,000 gamers to create a cutting-edge RPG experience that brings the all-time best-selling set of fantasy rules into a new era.

Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 5 includes:

- More than 300 different monsters.
- New player-friendly races like caligni dark folk, deep one hybrids, plant-bodied ghorans, and simian orang-pendaks.
- Psychic creatures both benevolent and terrifying, from the enigmatic anunnaki and faceless astomoi to the howling caller in darkness and insidious, alien grays.
- New familiars, animal companions, and other allies, such as clockwork familiars, red pandas, and many-legged wollipeds.
- New templates to help you get more life out of classic monsters.
- Appendices to help you find the right monster, including lists by Challenge Rating, monster type, and habitat.
- Expanded universal monster rules to simplify combat.
- Challenges for every adventure and every level of play.
- AND MUCH, MUCH MORE!

188608.name: Stonehell Dungeon: Into the Heart of Hell
188608.description:
"Stonehell Dungeon: Into the Heart of Hell is the long-awaited sequel to Stonehell Dungeon: Down Night-Haunted Halls. This book contains the final levels of the megadungeon, revealing its most terrifying secrets. It contains almost 600 dungeon rooms for the players to explore, more than 70 unique monsters to challenge them, and 13 new magical items to mystify them.

Stonehell Dungeon is a classic-style megadungeon intended for use with the Labyrinth Lord™ role-playing game, but adaptable to early versions of the original fantasy role-playing game and its retro-clones. It gives the game master the necessary information to run the dungeon, while offering enormous opportunities to customize the site."

Publisher Blurb

188609.description:
The first exciting expansion pack for Commands and Colours: The Great War by Richard Borg.

This expansion pack contains 6 highly detailed and pre-assembled 1/100th scale World War One British and German tank models, 2 German artillery pieces and 8 crew figures, 2 A4 punchboards of tokens and new terrain tiles and a booklet of additional Tank special rules including bogging down and "tankschrecken" and 18 scenarios to enable players to recreate the iconic first tank battles amongst the trenches of the Western Front in 1916-1918 such as Cambrai, Villiers-Bretonneux. Included are bonus Whippet tank scenarios and rules for onboard artillery.

The tank models are pre-assembled (and have a basic paint job and decal markings)

The tank models included in this pack are:

32 double sided terrain tiles
9 fortified/wire double side markers
4 bridge/damaged bridge double side tokens
20 British/German double sided tank silhouette tokens
15 bogged down/ditched tank markers
4 captured tank tokens

6 WWI tank models
- 2 x British MK IV male tanks
- 2 x British MK IV female tanks
- 2 x German A7Vs tanks

2 x German 105mm Howitzer models and 8 crew figures
1 rule & scenario booklet with 22 WWI battles
2 unit and terrain summary sheets
188609.name: The Great War: Tank Expansion

188610.name: Going Places in Europe
boardgameintegration: Going Places in the World - Globetrotter Edition
Going Places in the World - Globetrotter Edition
188610.description:
Discover the European continent!

Travel across the European continent and visit the different countries and their cities. Plan your trip and return to your home city to win the game!

Each player receives one Destination card to determine his or her starting position, or "hometown". Another 12 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your "hometown" via the 12 destinations.

To aid the traveler, train stations, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A player is never safe until he or she has returned home!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the continent each round!

188611.name: Going Places in the World - Globetrotter Edition
188611.description:
The ultimate round-the-world trip!

This extended version of Going Places, with 200 destinations including islands and Antarctica, offers the ultimate challenge for the explorer. New places, new routes, but only one winner!

Each player receives one Destination card to determine his or her starting position, or "hometown". Another 15 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your "hometown" via the 15 destinations.

To aid the traveler, train stations, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A player is never safe until he or she has returned home!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the world each round!

188612.name: Kings of War: Uncharted Empires
188612.description:
From publisher's website:
The heat shimmer that ripples above the parched earth does little to mask the horrors that lie assembled before you. You must focus on the task ahead. No plan survives contact with the enemy and the army you face is a howling, ravening horde of death that will test you to the limit. Today will be recorded in history but only one side will write it. Do you have the skill and courage to ensure it is you? Go. The time for war is now!

Welcome to Uncharted Empires, an Army Supplement book for Kings of War, the massed combat tabletop fantasy game set in the magical realm of Mantica. In this book, you are going to find:


Nine brand new Kings of War armies giving budding generals a whole host of new options and dastardly tricks to outfox and out-fight their opponents, including The Brotherhood, Salamander Armies, The Herd, The League of Rhordia, The Trident Realms of Neritica, The Empire of Dust, Night-Stalker Armies, Ratkin Armies and the Varangur
New special rules to further enrich your playing experience.
Lots of new background information on all the armies and the units within them.

188613.name: 3 Stooges Racing Rampage
188613.description:
This board game appeared in Dell's Four Color comics #1078 in Feb-Apr 1960; it was an issue that featured the Three Stooges. A simple spin-and-move Goose type game where players race through through town to reach the finish line first.
The game was later reprinted in Western Publishing's Three Stooges #39 June 1968.

188614.name: Simon's Cat Card Game
188614.description:
The fast-paced Simon's Cat Card Game features adorable art taken directly from animator and illustrator Simon Tofield's YouTube series, Simon's Cat, which has hundreds of millions of views.

In the game, players go around the table playing cards to escape Simon's attention. Get caught and you get Blame; get too much Blame and you get fed last. No one wants that.

188615.name: Legends of New Orleans
188615.description:
(publisher blurb)

Golden Goblin Press is dedicated to bringing the fans new voices and helping a whole new crop of authors develop their voice. Legends of New Orleans is a PDF collection of six non-mythos scenarios based on the historic folklore of the area by talented, but new (or newish) authors.

“Cauchemar” by Tyler Hudak—This rare treat is a one on one scenario, designed for a single player and keeper. A lone investigator is drawn down the rabbit hole while looking for a missing friend. Lost time, shifting realities, ethereal horror, and madness abound in this uniquely New Orleans ghost story.

“Serva Me” by John A. Almack—Wherein the investigators uncover the haunting past surrounding a young lady's antique chest. Their research into area colonial history leads them from the Garden District to the French Quarter, as they seek to unravel a tragic and ghostly mystery in one of the most haunted cities on earth.

“Deliver Me from Evil” by Jon Hook—Wherein the investigators help an old friend retrieve his prodigal sister from the debauchery of New Orleans. However, she has gotten involved with something far worse things than smoking, gin, or fellas. Her new friends aren’t keen on letting her leave, nor are they technically alive.

“The Second Voodoo War” by Nick Nacario—Wherein the investigators stumble upon a simmering blood feud between rival clans. A hidden instigator is stirring the pot and tensions are sure to boil over. Investigators soon find themselves caught in the middle of a full blown war fought with curses, spells, and the risen enslaved dead?

“Curse of Devil Baby” by Simon Yee—The story of the cursed Bowes family and their hideous demonic child is a well-known tale in New Orleans. The Devil Baby of Bourbon Street died long ago… or did it? Investigators are hired by the Bowes family to recover something stolen from them: the remains of a child, taken from a tomb marked only with an X.

“Never Cry Wolf” by Mark Shireman—Rougarou: a human cursed to change into a murderous beast. The word alone sends chills up the spines of the denizens of the bayou. Investigators respond to a series savage attacks on notable citizens. Fear and suspicion quickly spreads as sensational headlines and a respected priest lay the blame for the attacks on a rougarou summoned by “The Witch of Bayou Gentilly”.

188616.name: O Ataque dos Tubarões-Vampiros
188616.description:
From the publisher:

A Eron Dal Molin's board game, launched by Lends and developed by Foka Games.
In this fun journey, you're a pirate or a vampire shark alternately. As a pirate, mark points by surviving the attacks from the monster; as shark-vampire, gain victory points biting and turning pirates into new sharks. In both roles, just outsmart your opponents to win. It is a strategy game the escape tension is a constant and "backstabbing" among participants ensure laugh. Of course, a little luck can help in difficult situations.

Every turn the pirates can move 1-3 sea spaces swimming away from vampire shark and block the path of another pirates. Blocked pirates are easy to be bitten by vampire sharks that need to move 3 sea spaces straight to the closest pirate. Strategy cards can be played to help pirates avoid bites or by vampire sharks to move freely. At same time a treasure hunt is happening and as a pirate you need to take the treasure map and go to the right island to gain more victory points.

Being the last pirate alive you'll gain victory points so every turn you need to choose run away or block your friends.

188617.name: Daktari on safari
188617.description:
An old Greek game, probably having as a theme the famous American TV Series Dactari. Your goal is to catch the most wild animals in the jungle.

There is a price list for every animal you catch.
The game involve dice roll to move.

You move through the different tracks on the game board and you catch the animals when you bring the exact number on the dice roll , that will allow you to land on the same spot where the animals are.

But be careful, you may land on a Daktaris spot and then you lose all your animals .

188618.name: Space Run
188618.description:
A space theme game from Greece, made for a chocolate firm called ION probably was as a gift with chocolates. A very rare game !
Your goal is to travel in to our solar system and be the first who will visit all the planets.
You move with the spin on a well track that came with the game.
There are three faces.
At the first face to try to take off from earths gravitation force and travel to the moon.
You spin the well twice, first to to determine the track (lets say you roll 5) so your hight is five.
The second spin determine the speed of the rocket (must be more than 1 to win the gravitation ).That will allow you to move the rocket clock wise ( lets say that you roll 3, so at hight of five you move three spaces clock wise on the track around the Earth's orbit.......
The second face is the moonlanding
This face starts when the first rocket reach the hight of 7, then you place the moon token at the blue spot betwen the hight 7 and 8. And the game continues.
The moon always moves at speed of 1 clockwise at the and of every players turn.
To land on the moon you must be on a parallay with the moon at hight 7, when you reach thisand is your turn you put your space craft at the moon and you spin the well right away to reach the third face of the game....
At the third and last face you must visit the planets in the exact order Afrodite, Hermes, Aris,Zeus, Kronos, Houranos, Posidon, Plouton. You follow the same rule as the first face and some more rules.....

188619.name: Powerplay: The Game of the Gods
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC (Players re-release) Cassette edition
English / European Amstrad CPC 3" disk edition
English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
English / European Atari ST 3.5" disk edition
English / European BBC Micro 5 1/4" disk edition
English / European Commodore 64 (Players re-release) Cassette edition
English / European Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk (Astra Pack re-release) edition
English / European Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk (Enhanced re-release) edition
English / European Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
Spanish / European Amstrad CPC 3" disk edition
Spanish / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
Spanish / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
188619.description:
From the back of the box:

An original quiz game, for one to four players, that transforms you and your opponents into the mighty Greek gods Apollo, Hermes, Hecate and Aphrodites. Each god controls four warriors fighting to the death within the Temple of Apollo. To guide your warriors through the battle, you must demonstrate your wisdom by answering questions posed during the game. To eliminate your opponents' warriors, you must force them into a challenge - where their strength and agility will be tested to the limit in battlegrounds from the heights of Mount Olympus to the very depths of Hades. To win the game you must prove your leadership, as even the best warriors can have a will of their own. Powerplay comes with over 2000 questions and is illustrated in colourful 3D graphics.

User Summary

Powerplay is set on an 8x8 grid. Each player controls the family of a god. Each family has four grades from weak to strong. The player starts with four pieces at the lowest grade. When moving a piece, the player needs to answer a trivia question. If successful, wisdom points are added to their score. Wisdom points allow pieces to be upgraded to a higher grade.

When two pieces meet on the board, a challenge occurs with both players being asked the same set of questions simultaneously. The first person to answer correctly gets a point and the aim is to pull out a three point lead over the opponent to win the challenge. The loser of a challenge loses a grade. If the piece is already at the lowest grade, it is eliminated.

The aim of the game is to eliminate all the pieces of the opposing players.

188620.name: Almanac (Issue 1 - 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Preview of Lemurian Dreams:  The Exile

188621.name: Strätos
188621.description:
Catalog Description
