"Far above the clean, sweeping lines of a futuristic megalopolis, the first wave of craft from another world falls from the skies. Methodically, they work the skyline, releasing the most awesome of weaponry: the terrifying matter ravagers! Instantly, the energy envelope surrounding the city is punctured and several skyrisers sustain serious damage. The first step in the havoc complete, the pulsating vessels disappear into hyperspace as quickly as they had come. But in the span of a few brief seconds, more appear to
recreate anew the terrible destruction...."
"This is STRATOS — a kaleidoscopic explosion of awesome graphics and other-worldly sounds that's light-years beyond any arcade-type game you've ever seen on your micro! This joystick-compatible funfest puts you in TOTAL control of the devastating Armageddon Wave — the only weapon capable of decimating the attacking alien ships. STRATOS comes loaded with the professional features you've come to expect, including one or two player option, high score save, and mind-melting sounds."

"Designed for the home arcader who takes his action white-hot, you can be certain the thrills don't let up with this scorcher! STRATOS — look to the skies and prepare for the battle that will shred the universe!!!"

188622.name: Campaign Builder's Guide (Issue 5 - Jun 2007)
188622.description:
Campaign Builder's Guide
Issue 5
June 2007

A community written e-zine for OGL gaming

188623.name: Campaign Builder's Guide (Issue 6 - Aug 2007)
188623.description:
Campaign Builder's Guide
Issue 6
August 2007

A community written e-zine for fantasy world builders

188624.name: Campaign Builder's Guide (Issue 7 - Sep 2007)
188624.description:
Campaign Builder's Guide (The Campaign Builders' Guide)
Issue 7
September 2007

Villains and Vermin!
Uncommon Evil!
The CBG Big Bad Evil Guy (BBEG) Issue!

A community written e-zine for OGL gaming

188625.name: Fantaseum (Issue 2 - Summer/Fall 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Red Wake, Avatar of the Black Abyss
188625.description:
Fantaseum
Issue 2
Summer/Fall 2008

Maritime Edition

Journal of the Creative Community Alliance

188626.name: Viererreihe-3-D
188626.description: Bing-Go is a strategic game for two people. The winner of the game is the player who has first built up a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line with four pieces of his own colour.

188627.name: Who Gets the Bird?
188627.description: Published in the comic book, Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact volume 2, #7, November 26, 1946 on a "Thanksgiving Fun" page. A simple spin and move race game wherein two players race to be the first to get the turkey while avoiding spaces with Indians, bears, and arrowheads which force players to go back. A teetotum is used to determine number of spaces moved.

188628.name: Drivin' Force
videogameversion: English/European Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk (Arcade Action re-release) edition
188628.description:
From the back of the box:

Drivin' Force is a great game for driving maniacs. Take part in twelve different competitions. Race throughout the day or night in any of six vehicles, including a Jet-Ski for the bonus levels. You can even chose which nationality you want to be. Pit your speed, skill and endurance against the elements and eight other competitors in a hard fought battle for position. Races take place on the most tortuous of tracks, on 5 varied terrains, which affect each of your vehicles in different ways. Drivin' Force runs in fifty frames per second, the same speed as the fastest arcade machines. So, throw caution to the wind, put your pedal to the metal and drive for all you're worth to reach your goal.

188629.name: Christmas cracker cannon game
boardgameversion: Christmas cracker edition sold in UK
188629.description:
An abstract strategy game for two played on the intersections of the square of 9 cells, making a 4x4 playing area. One player has 6 red counters, the other has 6 blue.
Starting position: Red places 4 counters along the upper edge, and the remaining two counters on the two points on the sides that adjoin his two corners. Blue places his 6 counters on the remaining edge points.
Players take turns to move one of their counters either vertically or horizontally. The rules do not state how far a counter may be moved.
If, by moving a counter, a player creates a horizontal or vertical line of exactly 3 counters, consisting of two of one colour and one of the other, then the singleton is removed from the board. Rules suggest, but do not confirm, that the line of three must be unbroken. No capture is made if a line of four is created. Rules do not state what happens if horizontal and vertical unbroken lines of 3 are created simultaneously.
When one player loses all his counters, the other is the winner.

This game was included in a Christmas cracker in England in about 1998.

The name given above is a place holder, as no name is given. It was chosen as the board is embellished with a picture of a person with a cannon! The game is printed on a small piece of glossy paper, which also bear the rules. This is folded into quartets, and supplied in a small polythene bag, along with six red counters, and six of another colour (blue or yellow), weighing just 4 grammes.

188630.name: Boneworld
188630.description:
Boneworld: A Lost Souls Supplement

From the introduction:

In the Void between the Realm of Shadows and the Plane of Silence there is a skull. On a cosmic scale, it is minute, but as skulls go, it is vast. This skull is what remains of the god Golgoth, who once walked the young Earth and left to seek other worlds long before humankind appeared.
...
Boneworld is a semi-material plane.

188631.name: Unsung Story
188631.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Unsung Story started off as a successful KickStarter for a spiritual successor to Final Fantasy Tactics. Originally slated for a 2015 release financial circumstances at the company and layoffs led to a delay. Playdek also switched the focus from the narrative-heavy single-player game that was initially promised, to a multiplayer player vs. player game leading to project backer backlash.

188632.name: Artifacts and Bone Demons
188632.description:
User summary:

Artifacts and Bone Demons for the Lost Souls RPG presents several items for use with the game, including:


The Dead Man's Hand
The Eye of the Storm
The Teeth of the Storm
The Chickenbone Demon
The Shadowbone Demon
The Graybone Demon
The Wolfbone Demon
The Stonebone Demon
The Redbone Demon

188633.name: Yogventures
188633.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

The game allows you to create and shape worlds, then easily share them and play with friends! Yogventures will provide simple-to-use tools to design worlds that match your imagination and are packed with thrilling stories and epic treasures.

Yogventures was a successful Kickstarter that raised half a million dollars. The developers were unskilled and mishandled finances, loosing all of it.

188634.name: Phantom Dust 2
188634.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Phantom Dust 2 is a reboot of the original. The game is no longer in active development, Microsoft's Aaron Greenberg told Gamertag Radio in an interview at E3 — but it's also not canceled.

188635.name: InkQuest
188635.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Lionhead describes the game as "part magical map, part audio book, part adventure game". InkQuest was deemed good enough for it to be "incubated", which meant the concept was expanded and built into a prototype. This prototype tells the story of Sophie, a young girl transported into a magical book. The video, below, shows us what might have been.

188636.name: Project: EVO
188636.description:
The science behind our first platform, "Project: EVO", was developed at the University of California, San Francisco. We've deployed these mechanics from the ground up in a consumer videogame engine that runs on mobile phones and tablets, and meets all requirements for rigorous clinical studies. The Project: EVO platform is currently being tested in a variety of clinical studies in multiple patient populations around the globe, including ADHD, autism, depression, and traumatic brain injury.

Source: The Game Website.

188637.name: Star Fox 2
188637.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




The premise of Star Fox 2 is markedly different from its predecessor: Instead of following mostly linear paths inside predefined missions, the player moves a team of two ships freely around a map screen that represents the Lylat system. When the player's ships make contact with enemy forces, the game switches to an action perspective, piloting the Arwing ship directly with controls and game play similar to the first Star Fox. When the player clears the specified objectives, he or she is taken back to the map screen to select a new destination.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Fox 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188638.name: Ferrari Formula One
videogameversion: English/North American Atari ST 3.5" disk edition
English/North American Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk edition
188638.description:
From the back of the box:

Ferrari Formula One - the total Grand Prix simulation game. Are you ready to race? Start at the Ferrari test track at Fiorano by tuning the engine and testing the aerodynamics in the wind tunnel. Then pick your race from the 16 actual circuits used in the 1986 Grand Prix season. Earn your position on the starting grid through a qualifying lap and then its up to you!
Be the team manager, mechanic and driver. It's the survival of the fastest.

Credits:

The original Amiga version was by Rick Koenig.

188639.name: Worlds Without Master (Volume 1, Issue 10 - Nov 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Because I Clasp the Clouds as Mine
The Dread Geas of Duke Vulku
Three Dozen Delays and Distractions Upon Your Path
rpg: The Dread Geas of Duke Vulku
188639.description:
(publisher blurb)

Issue ten of Worlds Without Master, an adventure fiction and gaming magazine featuring sword & sorcery short fiction and games from Epidiah Ravachol and many others.

In this issue:

"Because I Clasp the Clouds As Mine," a tale of a shifting identity by Osmond Arnesto.
"The Hoard of Yengra," a tale of commerce and justice by Epidiah Ravachol.
Illustrations by Wendy Martin, Vlada Monakhova, and Tiffany Turrill.
Another installment of Bryant Paul Johnson's comic Oh, the Beating Drum!
The Dread Geas of Duke Vulku, a game of horror and wonder based on the game Dread by the original author, Epidiah Ravachol.
A miscellany of delays and distractions for any journey.
And full-color cover art by Jabari Weathers.

188640.name: Legend of the Wayfarer (1st Edition)
188640.description:
Legend of the Wayfarer
A Gamebook System

User summary:

This solitaire role-playing system allows single players to adventure through pre-generated adventure books using fairly standard table-top methods and mechanics. Characters select three Abilities to begin (and may acquire others later) from a list of twelve: Combat, Roguery, Stealth, Athletics, Charm, Perception, Lore, Magick, Mysticism, Survival, Pathfinding, and Trading. Characters also have Vitality and Will, which vary during play. Play also grants experience which can be spent to gain re-rolls.

The core mechanic has the player roll 1D6 against a target number. A fairly commonly occurring mechanic allows for re-rolls on failures. Combat proceeds in this simple manner as well.

This book contains a character sheet as a printable page.

188641.name: Challenge of the Faerie Lord
188641.description:
From the introduction:

Moordell is a small village near the Lorwen Forest. You stand in the village square and think about your options. Should you stay or seek adventure elsewhere?

User summary:

Each adventure book for Legend of the Wayfarer presents a solitaire adventure for use with the game. These proceed, typically, by presenting a paragraph or so of text followed by a test or decision which leads to another page. Each adventure book also has a page of random numbers in case the player is in a location that does not facilitate die rolls.

188642.name: City of Winterbridge
188642.description:
From the introduction:

Winterbridge is the largest city in the north with a population of almost fifteen thousand people. It is siutated on the river snow which allows the merchants quick transport south to sell the furs and precious stones from the mountains. It is also situated on a crossroads and all travellers will eventually pass through Winterbridge.

User summary:

Each adventure book for Legend of the Wayfarer presents a solitaire adventure for use with the game. These proceed, typically, by presenting a paragraph or so of text followed by a test or decision which leads to another page. Each adventure book also has a page of random numbers in case the player is in a location that does not facilitate die rolls.

188643.name: Deepbridge Danger Day
188643.description:
From the introduction:

The South East gate of Deepbridge is a welcoming sight. You walk through it to find yourself on a wide road. This is Castle Row and it leads from one side of the town to the other, past the keep at the centre of the town. To your right is a large, well kept, busy inn, called the Sojourner's Rest. There is another street nearby called Snatchup Alley.

User summary:

Each adventure book for Legend of the Wayfarer presents a solitaire adventure for use with the game. These proceed, typically, by presenting a paragraph or so of text followed by a test or decision which leads to another page. Each adventure book also has a page of random numbers in case the player is in a location that does not facilitate die rolls.

188644.name: Risky Ventures
188644.description:
From the introduction:

You have recently being staying in the village of Lorwen, a small village situated near a huge forest, rumoured to be infested with faerie folk. Wanting to return to civilisation, but not looking forward to the trek alone, you approach a merchant, Talas, who is ordering his gang to load up their gear. Talas is transporting timber to Deepbridge.

User summary:

Each adventure book for Legend of the Wayfarer presents a solitaire adventure for use with the game. These proceed, typically, by presenting a paragraph or so of text followed by a test or decision which leads to another page. Each adventure book also has a page of random numbers in case the player is in a location that does not facilitate die rolls.

188645.name: Ruination (Legend of the Wayfarer)
188645.description:
From the introduction:

The village of Freyton is a grim place. Most of the year, its rickety hovels are battered by freezing rain. In winter, this turns into snow and ice. The people of Freytown match its surroundings - grim, weather-beaten and humourless, they eke out a living mining iron from the mountains or delivering ice to the more southern cities.

User summary:

Each adventure book for Legend of the Wayfarer presents a solitaire adventure for use with the game. These proceed, typically, by presenting a paragraph or so of text followed by a test or decision which leads to another page. Each adventure book also has a page of random numbers in case the player is in a location that does not facilitate die rolls.

188646.name: Seek and Ye Shall Find
188646.description:
From the introduction:

You have found yourself in the lands of Baron Rogaris. The lands here are known for being peaceful and orderly under the baron's rule, so you have decided to come here to make some money and avoid mortal danger for a while. However, you have never been too successful on that front. However, it's not for want of trying.

User summary:

Each adventure book for Legend of the Wayfarer presents a solitaire adventure for use with the game. These proceed, typically, by presenting a paragraph or so of text followed by a test or decision which leads to another page. Each adventure book also has a page of random numbers in case the player is in a location that does not facilitate die rolls.

188647.name: Tavern of Spireport
188647.description:
From the introduction:

You are in the coastal town of Spireport, a den of brutal thieves and pirates kept vaguely in check by the equally brutal militia and the iron-fisted Lord Verek. You have the misfortune of finding yourself here, and decide to take a rest in the Shark Jump tavern, named for it's annual shark jumping competition. Not wanting to risk a fight, you leave your weapons at the door with the huge, scarred bouncer...

User summary:

Each adventure book for Legend of the Wayfarer presents a solitaire adventure for use with the game. These proceed, typically, by presenting a paragraph or so of text followed by a test or decision which leads to another page. Each adventure book also has a page of random numbers in case the player is in a location that does not facilitate die rolls.

188648.name: Test of the Warrior
188648.description:
From the introduction:

This book involves survival and using very few resources to succeed. Due to this, you might have to craft some items from raw materials around you. Some items will be consumed and some will be required, but they won’t be consumed.

User summary:

Each adventure book for Legend of the Wayfarer presents a solitaire adventure for use with the game. These proceed, typically, by presenting a paragraph or so of text followed by a test or decision which leads to another page. Each adventure book also has a page of random numbers in case the player is in a location that does not facilitate die rolls.

188649.name: Almanac (Issue 2 - 2003)
rpgissuearticle: It's the End of the World as We Know It!
Religion and the End of the World

188650.description:
Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition): The Fast Gun is a new character card for use with the Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition) base game.

Special ability: After the Courage phase, you will resolve your Bullet card before any player. If your target didn't lie down and you played a Bang!, the targeted player lays their Character down, take a wound and discards their card face down. They will not shoot this turn and will not take part in the sharing of the loot. Reveal the remaining cards afterwards.
188650.name: Ca$h 'n Guns (Second Edition): The Fast Gun

188651.description:
Components for solo play consists of a Special 1-Hex Rice Paddy and 9 cards which are used each turn to control the flow of water.

Per the campaign:
These components won't be available in the retail product - only as part of this Kickstarter and afterwards directly from APE Games at an additional cost.
188651.name: Spirits of the Rice Paddy: Solo Play Components

188653.description:
Bolg is a "3" card, it can simply be added to or replace Legolas or Tauriel.
It is German, so it targets for the higher number when comparing.
188653.name: Love Letter: The Hobbit – Bolg Promo card

188654.name: Mountain Crime: Requital
188654.description:
User Summary

A point and click adventure game, combined with a hidden object game.

You have been invited to a mysterious hotel only to find it virtually deserted. People keep being bumped off but who is doing it... and why?

188655.name: Twisted Lands: Shadow Town
188655.description:
User Summary

You are out on your boat with the love of your life, Angel, when suddenly you are knocked overboard. You wake up on the beach of a deserted island. As you explore, you encounter strange apparitions. Who are they? Where is everyone? And what is behind the dragon door?

188656.name: Famine at Holderfield
188656.description:
From the introduction:

This tongue in cheek adventure brings new PCs into a small town after an adventure. Upon arrival they quickly discover that the small agricultural community has just been robbed of its harvest supply. With the seasonal change coming those supplies are necessary for the town's survival. One of the victims of the attack was an alchemist. Contained within his bag were a few Potions of Growth. The bitter taste of the potion disagreed with the bandit who discovered it and he flung it into a field. Unfortunately for the PCs oversized fowl must be overcome before dealing with the bandits.

Set under the 5th edition rule set, this adventure makes for a nice side adventure to a campaign or a quick "one-shot" adventure. This challenge takes place at the end of the harvest season.

188657.name: Forest Legends: The Call of Love
188657.description:
User Summary

Humans have long outlawed all magic use, and teams of hunters exist to slay magical beasts in an attempt to put an end to all magic forever.

The Felize, a race of werecats are one such magical creature that the humans are taught to despise. Eveline is a young woman who has a forbidden relationship with a Felize named Aurelio.

As Eveline you must help Aurelio escape the hunters and try to restore peace between the two races.

188658.name: Sacra Terra: Kiss of Death
188658.description:
In Sacra Terra: Kiss of Death, the player embarks on a supernatural adventure to prove love can overcome the most powerful evil. This love exists in the heart of a woman who must rescue her fiancé from a demonic force that feeds on human suffering. Players guide her as she explores visually stunning mythical bid to reunite other lovers and weaken the grip of the evil entity. Offering a richly layered and compelling hidden object experience, Sacra Terra: Kiss of Death is an unforgettable adventure!

Source: [Http://company.alawar.com/news/36 The Publisher Website].

188659.name: The B/X Rogue
188659.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explode the talents of your sneaky characters with this book!

More than simply a thief, the rogue class has access to talents drawn from a wide array of archetypes, all integrated into a single class. Scouts & spies, burglars & tomb robbers, charlatans & con-artists, swashbucklers & explorers, brigands & highwaymen, assassins & thugs. No need for all of those specialised sub-classes any more!

Within these pages you will discover:

Complete advancement tables for levels 1 to 20
36 adventuring talents
Themed packages of talents for a quick start into the game
Guidelines for other classes attempting roguish feats
Rules for song magic and dabbling in arcane secrets




Suitable for use with B/X, Labyrinth Lord, and other old-school adventure games.

188660.name: Golden train
188660.description:
From publisher blurb:

Try to reveal secrets of Golden Train - a Nazis train packed with treasures and mysteries locked in underground shelter located somewhere in west part of Poland.

Try to discover what and why Nazis locked underground? Who guards the train and how it is secured?

Golden train can be used as mission pack which take place in the last months of WWII or as an adventure which take place in present days

Golden Train provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting game set in WWII (or weird war). It consists of GM’s notebook as well as stylized handouts which can be printed and presented to players

Please note that the supplement is stat free and can be used in any WWII game.

The supplement consists of two sections:

Documentation (GM section)
Intel files ( Players handouts)




Please note that Intel files are sometimes slightly different than material for GM. This is not a mistake - simply secret service couldn't get accurate data.

188661.name: 20 Undead Feats
188661.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ah, the sweet scent of the dead... Inside this edition of Feats of Legend is 20 22 new undead themed feats. These feats are designed for use with any character looking to deal with the dead. Become a powerful hunter of the shambling dead or use the dark gifts of death for yourself.

188662.name: Ships of the Galaxy: The Monarch
188662.description:
From publisher blurb:

"In a galaxy filled with literally millions of inhabited planets, few spacecraft stand out as exceptional. There are hundreds of competing designs for even the most specialized craft. What makes a particular design successful is often not its merits, but guile and sheer luck. Such is the case with Trans-Tech's Civilian Passenger Transport, the CPT-12 Monarch."

The first in our new Ships of the Galaxy series of spacecraft deck plans, The Monarch-class courier is the perfect addition to any science fiction campaign. A spacious and comfortable private ship, the Monarch is just the thing for a group of PCs set to explore the galaxy who don't want to settle for yet another light freighter and can't afford a yacht.

This 16 page PDF includes:

Two full page maps that are detailed enough to be blown up to poster size,
A detailed of history of the Monarch-courier that can be dropped into any science fiction game,
A complete description of the ship's major compartments and features,
Advice for GMs on how to add the Monarch-Courier to an existing campaign,
Ready made Adventure Seeds,
Game statistics for the white Star rules system
And four pages of full-size battle maps!




Weather you want to travel to a galaxy far, far away or out on the final frontier, the Monarch-Courier is just what you need to head for the stars!

188663.name: Post-Apocalyptic Vampire Wars
188663.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is role-playing game set after the apocalypse. In 2050 the worst symptoms of environmental collapse began to be seen. The fall of civilization did not come suddenly, it came slowly and inexorably. Dust came in a swirling blanket, carried by wind storms, gradually spreading across the whole globe, and blocking out direct sunlight. Even as the skies dimmed, temperatures climbed and then there came a time of destruction.

Crops failed without sunlight, wars over scarce resources spread across the surface of the planet. Wars fought by people and by newly designed robots. And, without direct sunlight, an ancient scourge was able to emerge from the shadows. Vampires began to stalk the land.

Some small pockets of civilization have survived the cataclysm that destroyed their world. These tiny communities are sometimes built in the remains of once glorious cities, sometimes they are isolated outposts in the desert. At the helm of each compound is a warlord, cult leader or other form of dictator. Living in the compound means you don't starve to death and aren't ripped to shreds by desert crazies. People will give up many freedoms in order to be safe, and most warlords run their compound with an iron hand.

For activities that are risky and benefit the compound, there are incentives. The brave warriors and scavengers who go out on raids, and who bring back the supplies needed for the compound to survive, are the nobility of the community. Join them, climb into your customized battle car and compete for the scarce resources of a blasted world, stalked by horror, with glory the only reward.

188664.name: Huntersheet - Red Alert
188664.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Doom Wisher gets lucky, A conflict alien seeks power and something evil is brewing in Downtown. Somebody has to sort this out.

Drop everything, SLA Industries needs you.

5 hunter sheets and Moral Right's new Virtue Squads in one 38-page PDF.

188665.name: The Thaumaturgic Codex IV
188665.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thaumaturgic Codex IV presents 20 unique arcane spells for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

Several of these spells are brand new and came from the development of another project (still in the works). A few of these spells first appeared in Bloodstone's other OGL titles but have been revised, improved, and updated to the new system. Included in this collection are spells of 1st to 9th level, such as:

Blasting Orbs: Carefully select which enemies will die in an inescapable inferno, maximizing their suffering while minimizing collateral damage.
Concussive Blast: Surrounded? We've got a spell for that. Enemies are better when they are 30 feet away, prone, and bleeding.
Killing Frost: Only the strongest creatures can withstand this supernatural cold that billows from the caster like a blue-white cloud of death.
Rolling Rock: A boulder emerges from the ground and begins crushing and pinning your enemies.
Shadow Spray: Seven shades of darkness spray from the caster's hands and render his enemies cursed, drained, and dead.
Shocking Bolt: Get your enemy's attention with electricity and neurological damage!




These and 14 other powerful sorceries await in the pages of The Thaumaturgic Codex IV!

188666.name: Beware the Tides of Karshoon
188666.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Gateway, the oldest city in the Northern Reach, a dead pirate’s vengeful curse has seized a poor neighborhood in a fearful grip. The people of Bilgewater have been beset by many ills, including mysterious thefts and unexplained occurrences. The recent destruction of a school by a rogue wave, including the loss of its students and teacher, was a devastating blow to the neighborhood. Worse still, folk have been torn apart in broad daylight before screaming witnesses, their bodies devoured in bloody chunks by invisible demons.

Beware the Tides of Karshoon is an adventure for a group of expert characters called on to deal with the curse. The characters must uncover the source of the troubles plaguing Gateway and put a stop to them—but all is not as it seems...

188667.name: VXen
188667.description:
From publisher blurb:

A catalyst for danger... VXen!

A Power Level 12 Rogue, VXen is an evil genius who sees every situation as a recipe for danger! VXen is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

VXen's file is designated "Blue" to represent her technological advantages. Her understanding of chemistry is superhuman, and she takes advantage of this mastery of the elements to manipulate any situation to her advantage. Her desire to gain power and complete lack of moral inhibitions makes her a very dangerous woman with unhindered ambitions. She makes a perfect foe for heroes who use their brains before their brawns, or for heroes dedicated to preventing collateral damage.

188668.name: "X" is for "X-Factors"
188668.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let Fate Decide

X is for X-Factors takes the concept of randomness in Icons and provides a series of tables for random events, including:

Crime
Disasters
Personal Issues
Alien and Supernatural
Super-Science and Technology
Plus some random options for quick background characters and super-names.

188669.name: The Shuhenja (Base Class)
188669.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Oriental themed divine class offers a new take on the original similarly named class. The shuhenja combines the thematic elements of the kami with the addition of the celestial (a.k.a Chinese) Zodiac. The Shuhenja chooses one of the twelve spirit guides represented by the zodiac which grants the class access to a particular elemental domain as well as other advantages. This supplement also includes a feat geared for the class and several new spells following the oriental theme.

188670.name: Unfinished Business
188670.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five Spooky Specters

Whether they’re monsters, villains, quest-givers, or information sources, ghosts always have the potential to be fun and exciting characters, and few Pathfinder creatures are truly able to blend mechanics and storytelling in quite the same way that a ghost’s rejuvenate ability does. But, because ghosts are so much more fleshed out, and have so much more personality, than, for example, shadows or ghasts tend to, they’re also a lot more work. This book presents detailed flavorful information on five different ghosts, including their background, the specific sorts of ghostly activities they get up to, and what needs to be done to lay them to rest. Stat-blocks aren’t included, allowing you to customize any of these ghosts to best fit your party’s level and abilities.

Included are…

Brandon Gordon, a ghost who continues to meddle in his son’s affairs even after death.
Carmen Spana, a ghost who continues to rob from the rich, though she no longer remembers why.
Lanhua, a ghost of a young drowned woman who searches for someone to ease her fear of abandonment.
Larzo Pundi, a mad wizard’s ghost who cannot rest until his experiment is complete.
Margret Rose, a ghost who seeks to be forgiven for the crimes she committed in life.

188671.name: Doctor's Orders
rpgseries: Case Files of the Blue Book Detective Agency
188671.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first in a series of Encouters and Modules after several decades for use with the GANGBUSTERS™ RPG rules. Doctors’ orders is specially designed for the game judge who needs to get back up to speed with the system.

Armed with pads of government-issued prescription forms, advised Dr. Levon advise his patients to take regular doses of hooch to stave off a number of ailments—cancer, indigestion and depression.

Gangbusters is a game that takes place in the Roaring 20’s and early 1930’s, essentially the Prohibition Era, of America. The focus of the game is on the Prohibition and the police/law enforcement struggle to control the streets and the halls of power. The player characters can take the roles of law enforcement, criminals, and other types of roles. The game is based in Lakefront City, ostensibly a fictional Chicago.

rpgseries: Southlands: Adventures Beneath the Pitiless Sun
188672.name: Cat and Mouse (5E)
188672.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who Do You Trust?

In the cool streets and blazing bazaars, the word is out: a great treasure has gone missing in the Everlasting City of the Cat, and some very ambitious people have set their sights on it. Many paws and claws are out, and everyone is sniffing around for something rich and strange.

It’s an odd time for a catfolk thief and a gnoll merchant to make very tempting offers to strangers in town. Or, perhaps it’s not odd at all. Get caught up in the hunt with Cat and Mouse by Richard Pett and Greg Marks!

This 5th Edition adventure for 1st-level characters is a perfect introduction to the [rpgitem/181166 Southlands] campaign setting, and it fits neatly into any desert city where cats are sacred and rats are cautious and sly.

188673.name: No References Required: A Bulldogs! Fiasco
188673.description:
From publisher blurb:

TransGalaxy Pangalactic Corporation. One of the largest and most powerful entities in the galaxy. Though the Company has their fingers in everything these days, they started out as a shipping service, and that’s still a core part of their business.

Class D Shipping Division. The difficult and hazardous cargo section of the Company’s shipping arm. Home of the desperate, the unqualified, and the just plain stupid. That’s where you ended up, most likely through fault of your own. The Company buys whatever junkers they can find for cheap, hires anyone who applies, insures the Hell out of the whole thing, and crosses their fingers that you losers can deliver enough hazardous cargo to hostile destinations to make it worth their while.

You are so desperate, such a fuck-up, or so insane that you took on this job. Unfortunately, so are your crewmates and so is your captain. Best of luck surviving your five-year contract!

No References Required is a Fiasco Playset using the mad galaxy featured in Bulldogs!

188674.description: A pack of 6 dice: 2 white defense dice, and 1 each of the four guild colors (green, red, yellow and blue) attack dice.
188674.name: Arcadia Quest: Guild Dice

188675.description: A pack of 6 dice: 2 white defense dice, and 4 black attack dice.
188675.name: Arcadia Quest: Extra Dice

188677.name: Lands of Calentria
188677.description:
From the introduction:

This is a perspective on some of the interesting sites in Calentria in the world of Filbar. A background of several governmental entities and excerpts from those who have adventured in the lands!

188678.name: Crone's Pursuit
188678.description:
From the introduction:

An adventure setting based in the Filbar campaign for 4-6 characters of 1st to 3rd level. Part of the Filbar 5th Edition series it is Playable in any campaign with Minor modifications!

188679.name: Asteroids: Outpost
188679.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Asteroids: Outpost is an open world sandbox survival game. Craft, customize, and upgrade your equipment.

188680.name: Shaft
188680.description: The game of the 70's movie. The 'private eye' detective is trying to locate a kidnapped daughter of a gang boss. Players secretly indicate the location they are moving to by marking it on a 'location indicator' disc. The game involves deduction (working out which location a player has chosen to move to). The game uses a vinyl game 'board' and was sold in a round plastic box made to look like a film canister. The game is marked 'X certificate', but that appears to relate to the adult-only classification of the source movie rather than game itself.

188681.description:
Heroes of Darkwell is a symmetrical Deck-Building game inspired by the Fantasy RPG Genre. Players assume the role of a villager, with unique scores in Strength, Agility, Intellect and Presence. Players collect XP by defeating monsters, which they use to purchase new skills and attack cards to add to their deck. Over the course of the game, each player's character becomes more and more powerful with a unique combination of skills and attacks at their disposal. Once enough XP is earned, each player's villager will become a hero, gaining increased attributes, more health, and a unique special ability.

Can you overcome all obstacles to make a hero capable of stopping the monster horde?

Even though Heroes of Darkwell plays like a cooperative game, it is, at it's core, a competition, as the player with the most XP from their monster pile wins the game and receives the title "The Hero of Darkwell".
188681.name: Heroes of Darkwell

188683.name: Bobby is Going Home
188683.description:
From the back of the game box

Leaping, leaping and leaping! Always happy, always cheerful in little Bobby's colored world. Let not the rolling stones and naughty ponds bother you, keep away from those troublesome birds and chickens. Let not the butterfly and ugly bat annoy you, even that extremely tricky bridge can't stop you.

Why not walk along the river side to enjoy the green field and blue sky. In the song of joy, we shall help little Bobby to go home!

188684.name: Tome of Horrors (Issue 4 - May 1986)
rpgissuearticle: The Fore Horse of the Apocalypse
You are Here Because You Want the Real Thing

188686.description: 10 pre-printed dice for use as the basic team that comes with the 1st & Goal game.
188686.name: 1st & Goal: Preprinted Dice Basic Team

188687.description:
Hide & seek is even more fun when more friends are playing! Have a few extra wands on hand so each child can have their own.
Wand works with Hide & Seek Safari Monkey and Tiger only.
188687.name: Hide & Seek Safari: Extra Wand

188688.name: Spellcaster: 2014 Expansion
188688.description: Spellcaster: 2014 Expansion consists of four new additional cards for Spellcaster.

188689.description: If you love playing Time's Up, why not make it personal? Customize your Time's Up game experience with this set of 40 blank cards (room for 80 new names).
188689.name: Time's Up: Blank Cards

188690.description:
Battles of the Thirty Years War (1618-1648) Series was originally published by TCS Games as several Desktop Published games. In the LCD tradition, they are perfect for those wanting a game that is fast to learn and quick to play. These games will include all new graphics, corrected errata, and consolidated rules.


The Battle of White Mountain (November 8 1620) was an early battle in the Thirty Years' War in which an army of 30,000 Bohemians and mercenaries were defeated by 27,000 men of the combined armies of Spain, the Holy Roman Empire, and the German Catholic League.



The Battle of Fleurus (August 29, 1622) was fought between a Spanish army of 8,000 men, and the Protestant Powers of the Holy Roman Empire with an army of 14,000 men. The bloody struggle left the Protestants mangled and the Spanish masters of the field.



The Battle of Lutter (27 August 1626) took place between nearly equal the forces (20,000 each) of the Lower Saxon Circle, combining mostly Protestant states, and led by its Circle Colonel Christian IV of Denmark, and the forces of the Catholic League. The battle resulted in a heavy defeat of Christian IV's troops by those of Emperor Ferdinand II, led by the Catholic League general Johan Tzerclaes, Count of Tilly.
188690.name: Battles of the  Thirty Years War 1642 - 1651

188691.name: Bridges to Albion
188691.description:
553 years in the future, seven colonies have been established on seven different planets throughout the galaxy. United Earth is stretched thin and has lost significant diplomatic and economic control over the 89 years since the first colony was established. Thanks to recent technological advances, a new planet, Albion, has suddenly become accessible through the construction of a series of space bridges. With this new access, United Earth has issued the Albion Initiative, which rewards the first pioneer that can successfully reach Albion by purchasing, constructing, and traversing four space bridges from their home planet. Once a player reaches Albion, they win the game.

In order to earn sufficient in-game capital to purchase the necessary bridges, players control a spaceship that they will use to accumulate wealth and to strike fear into the hearts of their fellow gamers. Players can complete a series of missions, buy and sell commodities on the intergalactic commodities market, and engage other players in combat in order to pilfer their stores.

Each turn taken consists of three parts: Tile Placement, Movement & Transactions, and Refueling.

Tile Placement: At the beginning of each turn, players must draw one Navigation Tile and place it in a space that connects it to that player’s game piece via the lanes on existent pieces. Through the placement of the Navigation tiles, the game board takes shape as game play progresses. Also, this means that no two play-throughs will utilize the same game board.

Movement: After the tile is placed, players can then move their ship onto spaces that are connected to their game piece. In Bridges to Albion, players can only move as many spaces as they have fuel to reach. Each fuel cell displayed on their Ship’s Console can be used to move one space. Each ship comes equipped with room for three fuel cells (an amount that can be upgraded eventually).

Missions:
Each player starts the game with three mission cards. These missions can be completed at the player’s discretion. Once a mission is completed and the corresponding reward is received, a player can choose to draw another mission card. A maximum of three mission cards per player is allowed. Mission rewards increase with each mission completed, so completing more missions is more lucrative. However, when a player is prepared to traverse their Bridges, any incomplete missions will incur a 500c fine for each Mission Card that the player retains. Mission Cards may not be sold, but players are allowed to conduct one-for-one trades between themselves throughout the game.

Combat:
Any time during the game that two ships attempt to inhabit the same space on the board, a combat event is initiated. In a
combat event, each player rolls one die. The player with the highest die roll wins, and the loser then must pay the winner the amount indicated on the pricing list. Ties are awarded to the non-attacking player. Battle losses are based on the number of missions the losing player has competed, and the more missions a player completes, the more they stand to lose in a fight.
Each ship’s weapons systems can be upgraded, allowing the player to roll more than one die in a combat event. The first
weapons upgrade allows the player to roll two dice, and the second upgrade allows them to roll three. The sum of all
applicable dice rolled is compared to the foe’s total sum.
It is possible for players to negotiate prior to a combat event being initiated in order to avoid the potential damage.

Transactions: Once a player arrives to a planet, they are free to conduct any business that they so choose. The Intergalactic
Commodities Market provides an opportunity to buy commodities on one planet and then sell those same commodities on
another planet for a profit. Each ship has a limit of 5 commodities, an amount that can also be upgraded. Ship upgrades can be purchased either on planets or in space.

Refueling: When a player has conducted all of their business, and is finished with their turn, they can then replenish their
fuel supply. Players are not required to purchase any fuel cells if they choose not to, but once they do (or decline to), their turn is then concluded.

Bridges:
In order to reach Albion, players must construct and traverse four Space Bridges beginning at their home planet. Once
purchased, players may place them in the outlined tiles. If a Navigation Tile has not been placed in a space, the Bridge may not be constructed over that space. Once (and not before) a player has built all four of their Space Bridges, other players have the opportunity to attack and destroy them. Once the player reaches Albion, they have won the game.

boardgameimplementation: Naseby: The End of a Reign
boardgamecompilation: Naseby: The End of a Reign
188692.description:
Battles of the English Civil Wars (1642-1651) Series was originally published by TCS Games as several Desktop Published games. In the LCD tradition, they are perfect for those wanting a game that is fast to learn and quick to play. These games will include all new graphics, corrected errata, and consolidated rules.

Volume I features four of the most famous and significant battles from the First English Civil War (1642-1646) which saw Royalist ('Cavalier') supporters of King Charles I against the Parliamentarian ('Roundhead') supporters of the Long Parliament.

Edgehill (1642): Charles marched on London intending to force a decisive battle with the main Parliamentarian army under the Earl of Essex.. They met at Edgehill in the first pitched battle of the war. Both armies were inexperienced and ill disciplined, and many fled or simply set about looting the enemy baggage train. As a result the battle was inconclusive and the war would continue for another four years.

First Newbury (1643): Almost exactly a year later and we see Charles again facing the Earl of Essex. The Royalists had enjoyed a series of successes which had left the Parliamentarians in disarray. As Charles besieged the town of Gloucester, the Parliamentarians mustered a force under Essex and through surprise succeeded in breaking the siege. They then fell back towards London. The Royalist rallied and, overtaking the Parliamentarians, blocked the path to London at Newbury. A surprise dawn attack saw the battle initially going in Essex's favour. Royalist counter-attacks were bloody and Essex was at risk of being encircled but fought back and pushed forward again - only to be slowed by Royalist cavalry. The Parliamentarian force was split in two but the Royalists attempt to drive through and encircle the wings was unsuccessful. With night falling and both sides exhausted the battle drew to a close. Next day, short of ammunition, the Royalists were obliged to allow Essex to continue his march to London.

Marston Moor (1644): This was to be the largest battle of the Civil Wars and saw the Royalists under Prince Rupert and the Marquis of Newcastle facing a combined English Parliamentarian /Scottish Covenantor force under the Lord Fairfax, the Earl of Manchester and the Earl of Leven. Rupert marched to break the siege of the Earl of Newcaste at York. The armies met outside York on Marston Moor but Rupert, who had sought battle, hesitated from attacking due to being outnumbered. Towards evening the Parliamentarian and and Covenantors took the initiative and launched a surprise attack. After two hours of fighting Cromwell routed the Royalist cavalry following which the Royalist infantry were annihilated.

Naseby (1645): Though the war would continue for another 18 months, Naseby was the decisive battle of the First English Civil War, seeing Charles' main army, led by the King and Prince Rupert, destroyed by the Parliamentarian New Model Army under Fairfax and Cromwell. The Royalists held a strong position on a ridge between two villages but left it when they saw Parliamentarian cavalry withdrawing. Having redeployed the Royalists attacked and the two centres were soon locked in melee. On the Parliamentarian left the two cavalry wings engaged. The Parliamentarian cavalry broke and the Royalists pursued. After an initial face off on the Parliamenraian right, the cavalry wings engaged and the Royalists were routed by Cromwell. Unlike the Royalists on the other wing, only part of Cromwell's horse went in pursuit, with the rest attacking the Royalist centre - at the same time as a smaller attack on the other flank. The King sought to assist his beleaguered centre by personally leading his lifeguard to the rescue but was restrained . Rupert eventually rallied the horse attacking the Parliamentarian baggage and returned to the field - but too late.
188692.name: Battles of the English Civil Wars 1642 - 1651 Volume I

188693.name: Get Home Safe
188693.description: Once you have completed the puzzle, take turns to spin the arrow and move your character accordingly. The aim of the game is to get home safely, learning about the possible hazards to avoid along the way. The player who reaches home first is the winner.

188694.name: My House
188694.description:
First create the scene, then find the correct items to match. Does the bed go in the kitchen, bathroom, bedroom? Where would you put the toothbrush? Television? Saucepan?
Take turns matching the different items from the home to the correct categories.
Who has placed the most tiles to the correct categories is the winner.

188695.name: TechMage
188695.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




(Publisher Blurb, Inside Cover)
TechMage is a Science-Fantasy Role Playing game that takes place on a distant world where both magick and technology live hand in hand, mysterious to most and mastered by very few.

This is a world in which mythical and fearsome beasts roam free. It is a world where the vast majority of Mankind, remnants of the old world, and native Elves and Dwarves alike attempt to eke out a life off the land, and one another, surviving in less than ideal conditions surrounded by constant struggle and strife. Technology and comfort, a grim reminder of the pre-cataclysmic world, is limited almost exclusively to the wealthy and powerful. Between these two extremes we find adventurers and freedom fighters, pirates and bounty hunters; all struggling for their own personal goals, be it fame, fortune .. or freedom.

TechMage has been designed to be a highly customizable Science-Fantasy Role Playing Game that can be played in a variety of timelines under numerous situations.

188696.name: Powerful Undead
188696.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 5 creatures: Berbalang, Bodak, Devourer, Mohrg, Penanngalan

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

188697.name: Legendary Beasts
188697.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has a huge monster book, but many creatures we loved in prior editions were overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 5 creatures: Dragon Horse, Dragonne, Phoenix, Sea Serpent, and Thunderbird

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

188699.description: Arcadia Quest: Pets is not only a campaign expansion, bringing a whole new campaign, with new scenarios, monsters, heroes, rewards, and titles, for use with either the original Arcadia Quest or the Arcadia Quest: Inferno core boxes, but it’s also a modular expansion that introduces Pets, a brand new system that can be added to ANY Arcadia Quest experience. This includes classic Arcadia Quest, Arcadia Quest: Inferno, Beyond the Grave and even Frost Dragon, The Fall of Arcadia and anything else Cool Mini or Not come up with.
188699.name: Arcadia Quest: Pets
boardgamepodcastepisode: #21: The Grizzled on tap, CMoN Expo, The Beer Traveler: Atlanta

188700.name: Weapon Master's Handbook
188700.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Don't just hack and slash like a fresh recruit! Rise above the rank and file to become a true artist of combat with the secrets found within Pathfinder Player Companion: Weapon Master's Handbook! Emulate the fighting style of your patron deity, learn to use your weapons in tricky new ways, or simply enchant your boring old sword with new and exciting magical abilities. Whether you want to perfect the use of a single weapon, become an expert on a whole group of them, or dedicate yourself to a specific fighting style, this player-friendly volume contains everything you need!

Inside this book, you'll find:


Weapon style feats giving characters focusing on one type of weapon or weapon combination new options unavailable to less specialized combatants.
Advanced weapon mastery options that let specialized fighters continue to improve with their chosen weapons, even at higher levels.
Magic item mastery, which pits a character's martial spirit against the essential nature of their magic items, resulting in radically different magic effects.
An expansion of the combat trick and stamina system introduced in Pathfinder RPG Pathfinder Unchained to cover combat feats from several Pathfinder Campaign Setting sourcebooks.
A weapon design system that allows Game Masters to let their imaginations run wild, adding almost any conceivable weapon to their campaigns.


This Pathfinder Player Companion is intended for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and the Pathfinder campaign setting, but can easily be incorporated into any fantasy world.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
188701.name: Ruins of the Red Moon
188701.description:
(from the back cover)

Ruins of the Red Moon is a solo module for use with the First Edition Advanced game system and is fully compatible with the OSRIC rules system. This adventure uses the Pacesetter Games & Simulations SoloSystem for enhanced individual gaming. The scenario is designed for a single, fourth level player character (PC). Any character class may successfully navigate the dangers in this module.

The adventure starts with the PC making his way through a desolate mountain range. Late fall has given way to a frigid winter. now and freezing temperatures threaten the PC with death by exposure. A blizzard is near and the PC must find shelter to survive the night. As he enters yet another barren valley, a massive and strange structure blocks his path.

This module can be played a a solo dungeon as intended or run a a standard adventure module with a DM and single player or multiple players. If used with multiple player characters, the PC level range should be reduced to first level.

188702.name: Occult Realms
188702.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Unearth Occult Secrets

The world of Golarion is full of ancient mysteries, hidden lore, and untapped psychic powers just waiting to be discovered. Pathfinder Campaign Setting: Occult Realms offers everything you need to explore occult themes in your games, including new rules, detailed locations, and preternatural inspirations to bring occult campaigns of any level to life. Inside this book, you'll find:


Rules options for each of the six occult classes presented in Pathfinder RPG Occult Adventures, including legendary spirits that skilled mediums can channel, Thassilonian phantoms tied to the seven sins for wicked spiritualists, and psi-tech discoveries and the mindtech discipline for specialized psychics.
Six locations ripe for exploration in occult campaigns, including a temple where astronomers from lost Lirgen still secretly toil, a university of psychic magic on the utopian island of Hermea, and the nation of Zi Ha in Tian Xia, where the samsaran residents live countless lives through reincarnation.
Half a dozen places of occult import beyond Golarion, including the Citadel of the Black on Aucturn, the Ocean of Mists on Castrovel, and the Temple of Desna's First Dream in the Dimension of Dreams.
Nine occult rituals tied to such iconic organizations as the false priesthood of Razmir and the Red Mantis assassins, allowing characters to achieve lichdom or temporarily transform into a half-fiend.
Rules for creating mystical idols that grow in power as their cult followings expand, plus two mysterious sample idols.


Pathfinder Campaign Setting: Occult Realms is a perfect companion for Pathfinder RPG Occult Adventures, and is intended for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and Pathfinder campaign setting, but can easily be used in any fantasy game setting.

188703.name: FML! The Game
188703.description:
FML! The Game is a modern, humorous take on The Game of LIFE. No longer are the days of going to school, working for the same company, and having 2.4 children with your heterosexual spouse. In FML! The Game, your life can go any direction: will you be a transgender hooker or a divorcee doctor with 9 kids? Every new game is a new experience!

To play, you first choose your gender, hop in your car, and start on either the college or burnout track. From there, simply roll the die and perform the action of whatever space you land on. If you land on a space that contains the FML! logo, draw an FML card. These are wild cards have instructions from paying money to singing a song.

After retirement, all players tell their "FML Life Story" - a hyperspeed explanation of why your life was the most unforgettable. How did you make your millions? Who did you father? Any interesting injuries or lawsuits? When everyone has finished, vote on the winner.

rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game
188705.name: Veteran
188705.description:
From the introduction:

Raise your hero's rank; Demonlord tips for creating and running lairs.

rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game
188706.name: Sorcery!
188706.description:
From the introduction:

The history of Sorcery is the story of Kartharka itself.

These events are spoken of in no books of legend or fireside stories. Dating back to the birth of the world of Kartharka this ancient history is known to none but the ancient demons that lie far beneath the earth of Kartharka.

Heroes and sorcerers may glimpse clues and scraps from their dealings with the demons but these will always be shrouded with lies and misleading tales, for the Demons still hate the living things above ground for trapping them beneath the earth.

rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game
188707.name: Lairs!
188707.description:
From the introduction:

This issue finally gives the actual rules and templates for creating your own Lairs. But what does all this mean? I wanted to create a new Role playing game from scratch. Something fun and easy to play, so anyone can play without a lot of reading or learning.

I also wanted to create something that was easy to write Lairs for, with some simple guidelines for relatively balanced encounters for the heroes. I wanted adventures that were fun to write, and easy to run.

188708.name: Free Lair: Huge!
rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game
188708.description:
From the introduction:

Venture forth! Again to the Winterlands, the heroes travel through the grand underground Highways of the Western Scarp.

Suddenly, tragedy befalls their band of travelers!

In a place of misery and despair the heroes must once again escape with their lives from adventure thrust upon them!

User summary:

Published as free online HTML, with three embedded "print and play" JPG images.

188709.name: Free Lair: Stronghold of the Warlord
rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game
188709.description:
From the introduction:

Behold! From beyond the mountains of the Grand Scarp, the Stronghold of the Warlord.

A scenario of perilous difficulty the heroes must first free themselves from the Slavers hold, only to throw themselves against the monstrous stone fist of the Warlords Fortress!

Many wonders await within.

User summary:

Published as free online HTML, with seven embedded "print and play" JPG images.

188710.name: Free Lair: Lair of the Stone Witch
rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game
188710.description:
From the introduction:

The witch of stone threatens to enslave an entire town, using her spirits to control the minds of the people. The town implores the adventurers for help and pledges their favor in support.

User summary:

Published as free online HTML, with three embedded "print and play" JPG images.

188711.name: Rothschild: The Sheep Will Wake
188711.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

The Rothschild family dominates the world. You play Jordan Baker, a journalist sent to investigate the hospitalization of Kane Rothschild.

188712.name: Scivelation
188712.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




The game was initially known as Salvation, and it was being developed using the Source Engine for PC and Xbox 360. A teaser trailer of this version was released in 2008. On October 2009, it was announced that a publisher has been found and the game was reintroduced as Scivelation, running on the Unreal Engine 3 and being developed for PC and Xbox 360, as well as PlayStation 3.

Later, it was cancelled but development restarted in 2013 for the same platforms. In Q1 or Q2 2014, the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions were cancelled and replaced with new PlayStation 4 and Xbox One versions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scivelation", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

188713.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #01 - Oct 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

Sanctum Secorum
Sanctum Sanctorum Podcast

Episode #01 Companion

October 2015

188717.name: Outre Realms (Issue 1 - Feb 2009)
188717.description:
Outre Realms
Issue 1
February 2009

TWERPS - The World's Easiest Role-Playing System
The World's Easiest Esoteric Dungeon

188718.name: Los Salones Anegados de Leviatan
rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
188718.description:
En lo más profundo del oscuro y tempestuoso océano, aguardan los míticos Salones Anegados de Leviatán, ahítos de monstruos terribles, reliquias de otrora y riquezas más allá de lo imaginado.

¿Serán nuestros aventureros capaces de arrostrar estos peligros o morirán ahogados y devorados por siniestras criaturas abisales?

Para personajes de nivel 5-7.

188719.name: Puzzlage
188719.description: Puzzlage is a jigsaw-puzzle, word search game in which 2-4 players take turns building a word search puzzle and pointing out words to advance. Players are eliminated when they become "puzzled" and can't come up with a word on their turn. The spinner piece in the center tells players which letters to use.

188720.description:
Based on the wildly popular new form of live action gaming in which a group of people gets locked in a room and has to solve puzzles in order to escape, Escape Room In A Box: The Werewolf Experiment has all the excitement of the “room” crammed into a box so players can have the same immersive and challenging experience in a one time play table top game in the comfort of their own home (and for a lot less money!).

In Escape Room In a Box: The Werewolf Experiment a group of two to six people has only one hour to work together in order to find clues, solve puzzles, and crack the codes that will unlock the antidote and keep them from turning into werewolves!
188720.name: Escape Room In A Box: The Werewolf Experiment
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ameritrashed: Episode #13
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 013 – Gaming Events
Episode 66- Dark Moon and Relationship Games
RDTN Episode 85: Golden Years – Chit Chat, Pandemic Cthulhu, Seafall, Portal Announcements, and Other Stuff

188721.description:
It is easy to get lost on sea without a map. Help Rumini to put the map's torn pieces together so that he can find his magical tools!

It is all done as a tile laying game where each tile is a piece of the map the players build. Each piece has a small icon in the corner indicating magic tools that can be collected which is also the goal of the game. Laying a tile is done through playing cards from a hand of four which does not change throughout the game as players redraw from a main deck to replace the one they played.
There are also some special cards that can help or challenge the players. These are just put aside and can be used at will.

All in all Rumini - The Torn Map is an exciting, quick game where beside luck you will also need some tactical skills and good memory.

Térkép nélkül hamar elveszünk a tengeren. Segíts Rumininak összeilleszteni a szétszakadt térkép darabjait, hogy mielőbb meg találhassa a varázseszközöket!

Izgalmas, pörgős kártyajáték, melyben a szerencse mellett sokkal inkább a taktikázás, és a jó megfigyelőkészség kap szerepet.
188721.name: Rumini: A szétszakadt térkép

188722.description:
This promo pack was part of the stretch goals of the 2015 Best Treehouse Ever Kickstarter campaign for all backers that backed at least a single copy of the game. It includes:


Advanced Bonus Cards: 6 more Bonus Cards! They are also hidden goals but this time the higher you build your secret formations in your tree, the more points they are worth!
Advanced Game Changers: 4 more score modifier cards will create even more ways to play and some extra strategic decisions for end-of-round scoring!
Birdhouses: For this variant, each player receives a Birdhouse Card to use once per game. Discard your Birdhouse to reset your Balance Marker and get yourself out of a tough situation.
188722.name: Best Treehouse Ever: Kickstarter Promo Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ112: Best Treehouse Ever (2015) Scott Almes

188723.name: Larger Than Life: Folklore Legends of America (HERO)
188723.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes, villains, legends … the folklore of America features all of this and more. In this volume you can find pirates and soldiers, lumberjacks and steel drivers, mountain men and lawmen, cowboys, Indians, inventors, and eccentrics. All of whom are just waiting to be included in your campaign! And don’t let the time period fool you, just because these characters existed in the 18th and 19th Centuries, doesn’t mean you can’t use them in your Pulp Hero, Champions, Dark Champions, or even Star Hero campaigns! After all, these characters are Larger Than Life!

Larger Than Life features 20 archetypes, ranging from Blackbeard the Pirate to the man who invented the 20th Century: Nikola Tesla. In addition, there are a total of 24 full character sheets, each with a detailed history and description of the character in question. But that’s not all! You also get over 120 biographies of other people related to each archetype, as well as famous ocean-going ships, famous outlaw gangs, Paul Bunyan’s entire logging gang, and other historical trivia. Each archetype also comes with at least one template, allowing you to build your own version of that archetype. So what are you waiting for? Dive in and start discovering those tidbits of American history you never new existed. But watch your step, because after all, these characters are… Larger Than Life!

188724.name: Larger Than Life: Folklore Legends of America (Savage Worlds)
188724.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes, villains, legends … the folklore of America features all of this and more. In this volume you can find pirates and soldiers, lumberjacks and steel drivers, mountain men and lawmen, cowboys, Indians, inventors, and eccentrics. All of whom are just waiting to be included in your campaign! And don’t let the time period fool you, just because these characters existed in the 18th and 19th Centuries, doesn’t mean you can’t use them in your pulp, superhero, fantasy, or even science fiction campaigns! After all, these characters are Larger Than Life!

Larger Than Life features 20 archetypes, ranging from Blackbeard the Pirate to the man who invented the 20th Century: Nikola Tesla. In addition, there are a total of 24 full character sheets, each with a detailed history and description of the character in question. But that’s not all! You also get over 124 biographies of other people related to each archetype, as well as famous ocean-going ships, famous outlaw gangs, Paul Bunyan’s entire logging gang, and other historical trivia. Each archetype also comes with at least one template, allowing you to build your own version of that archetype. So what are you waiting for? Dive in and start discovering those tidbits of American history you never new existed. But watch your step, because after all, these characters are… Larger Than Life!

188725.name: The Sands of Time
188725.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fate Plays Strange Tricks...

It looks like a pretty small matter at first. Apparently, there’s a particularly brutal, violent outbreak of super-powered industrial espionage.

Appearances really can be deceptive. Soon, the heroes are pursuing a strange and devious enemy through a maze of clues and underlings. From the inner cities of the USA to burning deserts, haunted jungles — and somewhere even stranger — the hunt is on.

The heroes need answers. Because the Sands of Time are running out, and no one can reverse that flow.

Or can they?

The Sands of Time is a multi-session scenario for a team of four to eight Champions superheroes of almost any power level. It includes details of no less than three new superteams, plus other organizations, groups, places, and NPCs.

And it could be the strangest thing ever to happen to your heroes.

188728.name: The Dog-Boy of Westminster (Savage Worlds)
188728.description:
From publisher blurb:

The streets of London are teeming with orphaned and abandoned children. Why does one small girl going missing make a bit of difference? Something lurks in the shadows of Westminster, something inhuman. Perhaps the traveling freak-show that has just come to town has some of the answers…

The Dog-Boy of Westminster is a short adventure for The Widening Gyre: A Savage Steampunk Setting. Guide a team of 4-6 Seasoned adventurers as they search for a lost child and uncover a terrifying secret. This PDF contains a full adventure for a Savage Worlds steampunk game, including a new master villain and a dozen freaks and geeks to challenge your players.

188729.name: Forgotten bunkers
188729.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forgotten Bunkers provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting game set in WWII (or weird war). It consists of GM’s notebook as well as stylized handouts which can be printed and presented to players.

Please note that the supplement is stat free and can be used in any WWII or modern game.

The supplement consists of four sample bunkers:

each bunker consists of:

its own briefing papers,
top down view map,
interior map.

188730.name: White Lies Admin Screen
188730.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is designed to help Admins run their game smoothly. While it's specifically made for White Lies, it's also broadly compatible with other OSR games.

The print version comes with eight inserts that fit into the Ultimate GM Screen from Hammerdog Games. The admin side has an enemy generator, a section for campaign notes and house rules, a complete reference for combat, action and saving throws, plus two pages dedicated to a pre-made espionage setting.

The PDF (which comes free with the PDF or standalone) has everything that comes in the print version, plus sheets for recording your mission setup, your villainous organizations and a cover. You also get a bonus agent class, the versatile Gadget Impresario.

188731.name: Sanctuary of Exsanguination (Pathfinder)
188731.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for 4-5 PCs of level four.

Many years ago the witch priestess Segolia established a temple in the frontier town of Feluxia. In exchange for healing services to the town, Segolia only demanded the weekly sacrifice of orcs and other raiding humanoids. As the frontier has pushed further away from the town and the area has become more civilized, raids by monstrous type humanoids have become few and far in between. However, Segolia still demands her sacrifices, and some of the townsfolk have begun to disappear. The mayor has hired the PCs to investigate Segolia’s temple as he believes her to be behind the recent disappearances, but is fearful of confronting her himself or sending the town militia for fear of offending her if she is not.

188732.name: Stuck on Etholk
188732.description:
From publisher blurb:

A seedy alien crimelord has broken free from a prison transport and you've been implicated in the escape. You're innocent of course—you were just in the wrong place at the wrong time—but nobody wants to listen. Can you brave the tar pits of Planet Etholk and recapture the escapee before every bounty hunter in the galaxy comes looking for you?

Stuck on Etholk is a White Star: Science Fiction Roleplaying adventure for three to six characters of 1st-3rd level. The adventure was designed to be dropped into any multiworld space opera-type science fiction setting. Stuck on Etholk involves a mixture of space combat, problem solving, and roleplaying, so a variety of classes is recommended.

Stuck on Etholk also includes four (4) new alien lifeforms for use in your White Star setting.

188733.name: Wicasa
188733.description:
From publisher blurb:

A plea to prevent an open war between elves and humans, and free a village oppressed by an evil overlord. Will the heroes prove worthy of the challenge? A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 8th level characters.

188734.name: Bishop Wischard
188734.description:
From publisher blurb:

With Tholy imprisoned and awaiting execution a new Bishop travels to Odill to replace him. The various factions of Odill have much to lose if the new Bishop ends corruption. The heroes could determine the fate of several organizations in Odill. A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 8th level characters.

188735.name: The Node
188735.description:
From publisher blurb:

The elves are incensed that the humans have allowed an elf to be sacrificed to create a magic item. The elves can be appeased though if the item is destroyed, but just as it takes a lot to create a magic item, it takes a lot to destroy a magic item. Can the heroes destroy the item to free the elf’s soul and prevent a war? A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 8th level characters.

188736.name: Ugly in Odill
188736.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the streets of Odill, a seemingly random event may lead to what the true source of corruption in the city has been all along. But it will take a group of heroes worthy of the challenge to finally eliminate the fiend responsible for the decades of suffering. A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 8th level characters. The fifth (and final?) episode in The New Odill series.

188737.name: Forge and Sacrifice
188737.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some creations must be undone to make the world a better place, but destroying an object of great power is not an easy task. Indeed, it will require true heroes to achieve such a goal. A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 sixth level characters

188738.name: The Newsletter of the Lincoln Middle School Dungeons & Dragons Club (Issue 1 - Oct 2009)
rpgissue: The Newsletter of the Lincoln Middle School Dungeons & Dragons Club
188738.description:
The Newsletter of the Lincoln Middle School Dungeons & Dragons Club

Issue 1
October 12, 2009
