boardgameexpansion: War of the Ring: Battles of the Third Age

188888.name: Crusader Kings II - Platinum Pack
videogamecompilation: Crusader Kings II: Legacy of Rome
Crusader Kings II: Rajas of India
Crusader Kings II: Sons of Abraham
Crusader Kings II: Sword of Islam
Crusader Kings II: The Old Gods
Crusader Kings II: Way of Life
188888.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Crusader Kings II and several expansions to the game.

188890.name: Casus Belli (v4, Issue 15 - Jun/Jul 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Colloque Universitaire sur le Jeu de Rôle
H.ell, T.2: La nuit, royaume des assassins
La critique dont vous êtes le héros
Le Manuel Pratique du Jeu de Rôle
Les Chemins de la mémoire - Scénario 5: Les cavernes de l'oubli
Les Chemins de la mémoire - Scénario 6: Jour de vérité
rpg: Wulin: Chroniques du Pinceau & de l'Epée
188890.description:
(translated) From the cover:

- 10 page preview of the Pathfinder comic
- Wulin, Skull & Bones, Pathfinder Unchained
- Retro: Trauma, D3: Last part
- Analysis: Virtual gaming tabletop, are they good?
- Cyberpunk for Chroniques Oubliées, rules and scenario
- Scenarios: Pathfinder (the road to memory), CoC, Wulin, Within and Chroniques Oubliées.

188891.name: Encryptopedia
188891.description:
Encryptopedia is a 32,000+ word systemless sourcebook for playing espionage stories in a fantasy world.

Sections include:
Agent Roles
Organizations, their structures and creations
Tradecraft levels
Specialized espionage items
How to run espionage campaigns using fantasy props

188892.name: Live & Let Dye
188892.description:
Bright lights, beautiful music, amazing food...

...and secrets wait in the wings!

Live and Let Dye is a systemless adventure designed for use with the Encryptopedia Fantasy Espionage sourcebook.

The stories in this adventure center around a beautiful gala called the Dyer's Guild Ball. Once a year the fashion elite of the city show off their most beautiful creations at this exclusive cotillion. The Ball marks the beginning of the Debutante and Beautillion season. And there is intrigue in every corner, every sideways glance, and every dashing smile.

Become agents in a fantasy espionage ring and help a spy defect, fan the fire of romance, help bring a patent thief to his comeuppance, or confront the criminal underworld - all in one night!

This adventure is campaign-agnostic but it is set in the same milieu as other works by Sam Chupp, in the Magical Country.

188893.name: The Forever Diamonds
188893.description:
The Forever Diamonds is a fantasy espionage campaign-level sourcebook for creating and running a series of sequential campaign-style game sessions using the support material found in Encryptopedia.

Encryptopedia gave you a general background on how to add espionage to your fantasy genre game, or add fantasy to your espionage game. The first adventure for the sourcebook, “Live & Let Dye,” gave you a framework for an adventure set with that sourcebook in mind. The Forever Diamonds will give you campaign notes, a setting framework, characters, and background so that you can continue what you started.

This sourcebook offers:

28,000+ words in both PDF and epub formats and access to any updates thereafter.
Deep background on two factions introduced in Encryptopedia: The Heralds of the Queen and the Honorable Old Masters; in addition to the inclusion of a new secret cabal faction called the Shadowhood.
Details on a special power set called scaetha, a talent based on the elemental power of shadow.
The ability to run characters in any or all of the three factions presented: Heralds of the Queen, secret arcane agents of the Shadowhood, or gangsters from the Honorable Old Masters.
A conflict management system to keep track of the positions each faction holds in your campaign.
Guidance on running the campaign from the start where your players will uncover the secrets of the aeon gems, also known as the Forever Diamonds, to the middle campaign where the factions will discover each other and immediately fall into conflict, to the final phase of the campaign where the fight over this finite but powerful resource grows to threaten all those who desire it.
Key events in the campaign are defined, but the engine of the story is up to you, as you are in control of the reactions of the factions the players are not playing.
The Forever Diamonds is written and designed by Origin-award-winning game designer Sam Chupp, the co-creator of Changeling: the Dreaming and Wraith: the Oblivion.

188895.name: Drunk Uncles
188895.description:
As idiot uncles attending a family gathering in Drunk Uncles, a press-your-luck card game, you must get as many of your terrible opinions off of your chest as possible before you wear out the welcome of your fair-minded family. Players draft dice to determine their tolerance level and carefully play from their hand hoping to duck under the judgement of their family.

In game terms, players each start with a hand of seven cards and a d4, d6 and d10 is placed in a shared pool (The Bar) for each player; cards range from 1-10 in four suits with three ?!?!? cards in each suit.

In a round, each player completes one turn. On a turn, a player takes up to three dice from The Bar, rolls them to determine the current Tolerance value, then plays as many cards as desired from their hand as long as each card is less than the Tolerance value. If a player has no such cards, they can draw the top card and play it; if it's equal to or higher than Tolerance, they bust and lose all their cards. If they play a card equal to 8 or higher, opponents can play as many ?!?!? cards as they want of the same suit.

After all cards have been played, the player scores points equal to the number of cards played multiplied by the number of dice rolled, then subtracts ten points for each ?!?!? card played. Finally, the active player refills their hand to seven cards.

After each player has had a turn, return all dice to The Bar, then start a new round. When the last card has been drawn from the deck, finish the round. Whoever has the most points wins.

188897.name: The Show Must Go On!
188897.description:
The Show Must Go On! features two teams of player actors who attempt to perform their roles in the included play Covet Thy Neighbors' Asses! so convincingly that their teammates can guess the occupation, motivation or affectation that they are attempting to exhibit during their performance (with these three characteristics being determined by cards drawn by the players at the start of play). If the teammates guess correctly, the actor wins a coin and keeps the appropriate card; if not, the actor may return a previously collected coin to discard one of their cards.

After completing three portions of dialogue in the play or having no cards in hand, an actor moves to the bottom of the line-up and refills their hand, then one of their teammates takes the stage. The two teams perform in turn as separate characters in the play, so two actors are always "on stage" performing during the game.

When the play ends, each team scores one point for each piece of gold it has and the indicated points on the cards it has pocketed. Which team has performed better wins!

188898.name: To Judge a Soul, Part 2: Karma Reclaimed
188898.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3–7.

Venture-Captain Bakten's past lives and the history of northern Tian Xia are interwoven, and with the PCs' assistance he has uncovered a troubling legacy secreted within the mountains of Zi Ha. It is up to the Pathfinders to ascend into the ice-capped mountains to unveil the crimes of past generations and save one of the region's greatest heroes.

"Karma Reclaimed" is the second scenario in the two-part To Judge a Soul campaign arc. It is preceded by Pathfinder Society Scenario #7-06: To Judge a Soul, Part 1: The Lost Legacy and is intended to be played in order.

188899.name: The Blakros Connection
188899.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5-9.

A recent attack on the Grand Lodge became all the more heinous when one of the invading agents employed an eldritch relic to abduct a high-ranking Pathfinder. In order to release the captive, the Society must understand the relic and track down the fleeing operative—a mission that leads the PCs into Absalom's most prestigious archives to uncover a dark secret.

Content in "The Blakros Connection" also ties into a special metaplot element from Pathfinder Society Special #6-98: Serpents Rise. Players who have completed that special event are encouraged to bring its Chronicle sheet when playing this adventure.

188900.name: Puzzle Dice
188900.description: Puzzle Dice is a quick playing abstract game for two players in which the players draft dice from an open display over 12 rounds and place them on their individual player boards with 6x6 spaces. The dice come in 6 different colors and as they are rolled before the drafting can have values between 1 and 6. The aim of the game is to create lines, rows and diagonals of dice in which each color and or each number is unique. Sacrificing the scoring potential for a line, row or diagonal (by placing a duplicate color or number) gains that player a wild die which in a later round can be placed instead of a drafted die from the display. After both players have filled up their boards all lines, rows and diagonals that fulfill these criteria are scored and the player with the highest score wins the game.

188901.name: Skyfire Tree
188901.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each release for Crawthorne's Catalog of Creatures for the Pathfinder RPG presents a single, new creature for your Pathfinder RPG game, as presented by the famous and retired monster hunter and adventurer, Lord Crawthorne. Each release presents game stats for the new creature, as well as three adventure ideas to help insert them into your game.

You may think the most dangerous attack the Skyfire Tree possesses is its bite, based on its massive, sharp teeth filled maw. You would be wrong. A skyfire tree is not only capable of unleashing a deadly electrical blast, but also stealing a victim's thoughts for the purpose of enhancing its own sense of identity. Although not inherently evil, these plant creatures are self-serving and dangerous.

188902.name: Ogres of the Fen
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
188902.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the midst of the expansive fen south of Lorview, Stonefar the chieftain rules the ogrish community of Gaundelfen.

A great goblin army in the southern mountains plague the Gaundelfen and the surrounding hills defending their mines. The ogres maintain a sense of protection for the humans between the unpredictable goblin horde and their village. An unsettling symbiotic relationship has emerged from the precarious situation.

The residents of Lorview take a little solace in the idea that their southern border is protected when they hear the heavy ogre drumming on the fen. Little thought is given to the Gaundelfen sacrifice or struggles, only that Lorview can rest easy without ogres or goblins razing the village.

Now the ogres have come to Lorview, fleeing in terror from their fen. Smashing barns, eating sheep and spilling blood! Horror has struck Lorview as much as it has the Gaundelfen tribe.

Who will stop this plague and find out why the ogres have come to Lorview?

What can possibly be happening in the fen when powerful ogres flee in terror from their marsh at night?

188903.description:
This expansion was an exclusive crowdfunding project in Poland and Germany, inspired by the success of Theomachy: The Ancients and Theomachy: The Warrior Gods, re-implementations of the original Teomachia game, released in coopeartion with Petersen Games. It brings gods from Cthulhu Mythos (Great Old Ones, Outer Gods and the Nightmares) as well as Aztec and Egyptian deities to the world of the war of mythological gods, without changing the main concept of a deck-building game with a drafting and bidding mechanism. It consists of several mini-expansions (available only in this bundle, not separately):

Heroes - one extra Hero card for each pantheon
Priests and Prophets - one extra Special Prophet or two extra Special Priests with unique abilities for each pantheon (wooden discs with stickers and reference cards)
Reward deck - new bonuses for the winner of a round (instead of a regular one)
Miracle tokens - acrylic crystals to replace the regular cardboard tokens

New Pantheons available:

Aztec (Quetzalcoatl, Nanahuatl, Coatlicue)
Egyptian (Anubis, Bast, Maat)
Great Old Ones (Cthulhu, Hastur, Ithaqua)
Outer Gods (Nyarlathotep, Shub-Niggurath, Yog-Sothoth)
Nightmares (Chaugnar Faugn, Ghatanothoa, Tsathouggua)

The Polish edition also includes a re-printed rulebook for the base-game and 4 Last Stand cards, originally available in the German and English editions of the base game.
188903.name: Teomachia: Mity Cthulhu

188904.name: The Witch Doctor
188904.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a Witch Doctor. You use your magic to help your allies, keep yourself safe using protective talismans called mojos, see if a course of action is a good idea, heal hurt creatures, work the roots to craft herbal medicine, use your voodoo to curse your enemies, or even control them with your zombi powder.

This product contains two files:

A 17 page playbook containing 23 moves, gear, magic items, and two compendium classes.
A two page character sheet for you to record your character's stats, gear, and moves.

188906.name: Escape from T-Rex Island
188906.description:
Four exploration teams are racing to get back to their base camp on an uncharted island. Behind them is a furious & hungry T-Rex. The teams must get the crews to the base camp as soon as possible before they become dinner of the beast. They also need to get enough food to feed the survivors or people will start to fight for food.

Escape from T-Rex Island is a quick family game for 2-4 players. Each player controls three teams of survivors but only two actions may be taken each turn, so a player must choose which team to move. On the way back to the camp, players may encounter other fearsome dinosaurs like raptors & pterosaurs. Players must avoid the dinosaurs while collecting food & weapons dropped from the victims. Besides, players may take valuable dinosaur pictures for bonus scores.

In each turn, a player has two actions. You may play an action card to move a team or to take a picture if available. You may also spend an action to draw a card from the deck. But beware. No more than four cards can be held in hands.

The game ends when a player has 3 teams back to the camp. Then players score VPs for survivors & dinosaur pictures. The player who scores most VPs wins.

188907.name: Morphine
188907.description:
User Summary

A student drama story with pink rabbits. It is considered unintentionally funny.

188908.description:
The goal is to become the richest merchant by hoarding as many Coins as possible. Each Player earns Coins by selling crafted Gems and Jewels. The game is divided in Turns, every Turn is completed when each Player completes his Round.

At the start of the game the cards are placed in two rows, Characters and Gems, for a total of seven columns. Each column represents a City. Every city has two slots one for a Character one for a Resource.

During his Round a Player can execute three Actions from a list of six:

Travel to another City
Buy Gems or Gold
Craft Jewels or Gems
Interact with a Character: Sell a Jewel or a Gem, hire a Mercenary or fight a Monster
Refill City slots if empty
Earn a Coin




The Player can travel between the columns, which represent Cities. Traveling between Cities costs Coins.

The Player can buy a Gem from his current City and add it to his hand.
Before a Jewel or a Gem can be sold, the Player has to spend a crafting action to lay the cards down. To craft a Jewel the Player needs also the right combination of Gems and Gold. So each Player always has a round to plot against the seller.

Selling a Jewel or a Gem to a Buyer means discarding it and earning its value in Coins. Mercenaries and Monsters can hinder or favor the Players. After a Player interacts with any Character, the card is added to the discard pile.

At the beginning of each turn the Cities are repopulated with new Characters and Gems. At this time many Events can be triggered.
The game ends when a City can’t be refilled at the start of the Turn.

The Player with most Coins wins the game.
188908.name: Jewels

188909.name: Seizer's Chess
188909.description:
Seizer's Chess is chess variant.

The first distinction is that the pieces are flat shapes that indicate movement more than rank. The shapes can be stacked in a way that allows players to still tell what pieces are stacked on top of each other.

The second distinction is gameplay. Instead of eliminating a piece from the game when it is captured, the player actually captures, or Seizes, it and adds it to the piece they used to capture it.

For example, if a Rook captures a Knight, the Rook+Knight can now move as a Knight or a Rook, the choice is up to the player.

If that combination piece is captured, then it transfers its powers on to the next piece - and so on. This applies to Kings as well, (as the capturing piece). Player could potentially end up with a King that can move like a Queen and leap like a Knight.

The creator claims that the game is so volatile that a computer cannot defeat a human player in this game.

188910.name: Outlanda Games Ezine (Issue 1 - Dec 2001)
rpgissuearticle: An Article About the Lack of an Article

188913.name: Outlanda Games EZine (Issue 4 - Mar 2002)
rpgissuearticle: How to Build a Defendable Keep

188918.name: Dark Mysteries: The Soul Keeper
188918.description:
Charles Dexter Ward has summoned you to the island of Pawtuxet to stop a renegade spirit that is murdering the townspeople. The spirit is using human souls to become immortal, and you will be next if you can’t stop him. Based on the novel by H.P. Lovecraft, this Hidden-Object Puzzle Adventure game will test your investigative skills as you solve the mysteries of Ward’s family and complete the ritual that will banish this evil spirit once and for all!

Source: The Developer Website.

188919.name: Artefakt (Issue 5 - 1995)
188919.description:
Containing adventures for the following RPG systems:

- KULT (Schmutzige Geschäfte)
- Shadowrun (Geisterhaft)
- Earthdawn (Das beste Stück des Händlers)

188920.description:
This War Of Mine: The Board Game is the tabletop adaptation of the award-winning video game that pictures the drama of civilians trapped in a war-torn city.

You will enter this experience as a group of civilians trapped in a besieged and conflict-ridden city, enduring many hardships that often test the essence of humanity.

During day time you will take shelter in a ruined tenement house, which you will care about and manage by: removing rubble, searching through various rooms (often behind barricaded doors), you will build beds, improvised workshops, stoves, tools, water filters, small animal traps, you will cultivate an improvised vegetable garden, fix the tenements’ shelled facilities, reinforce the security of your shelter and should winter come, you’ll try to keep it warm.

Upon nightfall your main duties will consist of guarding your shelter and what little possessions you can accumulate against bandits and raiders. Those in your group fit for such a task will use the cover of the night to carefully explore dozens of the ever-changing locations scattered throughout the dangerous city in search of all the things that a person needs to survive (materials, food, meds, equipment, etc.). On your way you will meet tens of characters, each with a unique story (residents of the locations you visit, thieves, bandits, soldiers, war victims, refugees, neighbors, traders and members of local communities), each encounter is a potential, unique adventure. To guide you through all these events you will have the special SCRIPTS mechanism, responsible for implementing the deep and complex story and a coherent plot (each game will be unique and different than the previous).

Your goal is to SURVIVE until the cessation of war hostilities. During your struggle as the survivors, you will experience dramas connected with making extremely difficult decisions and choices (you will have to face the consequences of your actions sooner or later in the playthrough). Survival itself will often prove not to be enough. The price each of you will decide to pay, might be too high in the final outcome. So the goal is really to survive in a way that will let you live on with the decisions you made. The EPILOGUES mechanism will kick in here.

TWOM The Board Game features a multiplayer experience for up to 6 players, as well as a solo variant. You will be able to personify one of the well-known characters from the electronic version of the game
and face hundreds of new challenges and difficult choices.

The boardgame significantly broadens the original game’s universe and emphasises the depth of plot, yet its main focus will be on human interactions driven by survival instinct and group decision-making.

The project aims to omit the usual boardgame threshold - TWOM the board game is an INSTANT PLAY game, with no need for reading the manual before starting the adventure.

Experience the simulation of a struggle for survival as a group of civilians facing a blind and merciless war.

In war, not everyone is a soldier.
188920.name: This War of Mine: The Board Game
boardgameexpansion: This War of Mine: TV Set Promo
boardgamepodcastepisode: 10. Devon Dice are joined Christoph from Meeples' Corner shop
9. Devon Dice Podcast - The Gallerist Review  and more
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 019 – 10 Reasons to Buy a Game
Episode 27: Broom Service Review - Questions from a Hat
HLG 6: Samen
The Game Pit: Episode 64 - Automobiles and more….

188921.name: Medium Habitat
188921.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is the medium habitat, a more widespread, scaled up version of the small habitat.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

188923.name: Ultimate Celts Guide: The Lands of Albion
188923.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wind swept isles of Albion have long held the popular imagination, and legends are still being invented about the Celtic peoples. In modern times, the Cornish, Welsh, Scottish, Irish, and Manx are the heirs to the Celtic line. In ancient times, the Celts were spread across continental Europe and the Isles. They held great kingdoms and were skilled on horseback, at crossing the oceans, and at strength of arms.

There is much difficulty in separating reality from myth regarding the Celtic peoples, especially given their own penchant for interweaving their myths with reality. Theirs was an oral tradition, and much was not written down until far after. This feeds our view of the Isles being a place fogged in myth and legend. They fought against the Romans, terrifying even the most trained of Legions, traded with the ancient Greeks, built castles on the barest of ocean rocks, and more.

The Ultimate Celts Guide is a sourcebook for Savage Worlds that seeks to convey a handful of polished gems made from the myth and history of the Celts, ensuring you can utilize these people and their legends in your games. Remembered for their ferocity in battle, their bravery that bordered on foolhardiness, and their love of land and place, the Celts are as much a people of story as they are people in history.

Ultimate Celts Guide includes:

A brief history of the Celtic people.
Ranks within Celtic society.
A look at the Celtic lands.
An overview of Celtic mythology.
Options for creating Celtic characters.
Non-player Characters.
A Celtic adventure.
... and more!




Ultimate Celts Guide can lay the groudwork for a historical or alternate history adventure set within the Celtic lands of old. It can also be used as a guide for creating Celtic characters within fantasy games.

188924.name: Ultimate Mass Battle Guide
188924.description:
From publisher blurb:

Note: The Ultimate Mass Battle Guide is an extract from Savage Insider Premium Issues #2 and 3 and presented here as a standalone product. The content has not been altered other than for layout purposes and an added section for Character Options. Savage Insider Premium is a quarterly magazine dedicated to providing quality content for Savage Worlds and the many Savage Worlds settings published by Mystical Throne Entertainment.

The Ultimate Mass Battle Guide for Savage Worlds is your handbook for expanding on the Mass Battle mechanics presented in the core rulebook. New options are presented to offer greater control over the battlefield and new options to better represent your armies and their abilities. With these new mechanics, you can now take into account the skill level of your armies and the design of the battlefield. It’s time to for war and now you can even the odds.

Ultimate Mass Battle Guide is an alternate and expanded version of the Mass Battle mechanics for Savage Worlds and includes the following:

Composition: Rate you armies according to their abilities and weaponry, not just their size.
Range: Battlefields are a dynamic place and armies are designed to compensate for ranged and melee confrontations. These mechanics allow you to use range to your advantage.
Heroic Intervention: Heroes aren’t going to sit idle and with these mechanics, the PCs can have a bigger impact on the entire battle.
Character Options: To further your character designs, here is a new set of character options that embrace Mass Battle and the mechanics presented herein.

188925.name: Elvish Nation
188925.description:
From publisher blurb:

The soucebook for Shaintar's elves, Elvish Nation takes you deep through the forests of this proud and magical people. You'll learn about the Unias, Quo-Unias and about the delicate balance between tradition and progress or the older Eldakar vs. the Alakar. We'll talk about everything from Architecture to Beliefs and rituals.

There's no nobles or peasants but there are terms given to certain people in this society and they're here too. There's also a number of NPCs and story hooks ready for a GM to use to enhance a campaign along with some new edges from the creator of this realm, Sean Patrick Fannon.

188926.name: Tropicana
188926.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once upon a time in the Caribbean...

In Tropicana, characters are adventurers, rogues and troubleshooters, on the narrow border between law and something else.

They are detectives and spies, gamblers and mercenaries, exotic dancers and celebrities in need, traffickers and thugs, pilots and mercenaries, surfers and tourists, students and activists. They will surely find themselves in trouble, be hired to handle trouble or actively look for trouble. And trouble in San José is always big, complicated and twisted.

And after any adventure, they like to have boat drinks and smoke cigars together by the poolside.

Tropicana is a game of action heroes, special agents and troubleshooters in San José, a rogue state consisting of a tropical metropolis, its wild jungle hinterland and a small archipelago of
paradise islands.

Fight criminals, investigate ancient mysteries, solve cases, seduce the most beautiful men and women!

Now grab your gun and a mojito and join the spies, billionaires and rebels in this gangsta's paradise!

188927.name: Demonomicon of Iggwilv: Belaphoss
188927.description:
User summary:

One-page PDF containing Dungeons & Dragons 5th-edition write-up for Belaphoss, a demon villain from the Sword Coast Legends video game.

From the introduction:

Belaphoss the Mad is an ancient and powerful balor with ambitions to godhood. Called the Left Hand of Demogorgon, the Devourer of Hope, and the Warlord of the Gibbering Hordes, he has long waged war across the Abyss.

188929.name: Across the Wide Missouri-An adventure game of mountain men and Indians
188929.description:
In keeping with the spirit of the Rocky Mountain fur trade, Each of the four game pieces represents a fur brigade:
1) The Rocky Mountain Fur Company
2) Manuel Lisa's Missouri Fur Company
3) The Mountain Fur Company
4) The men of the Hudson's bay company
As a player you move out across the wide Missouri river into the wild, free country in search of Fur and riches.

The object of the game is to return to one's starting point with as many packs of Beaver pelts or Trade goods, or their equivalent in blood brother cards and fort ownership, as possible.

The game is played until each of the players has moved over all of his hunting trails, designated by his particular color, through the Rendezvous twice, and back home. Each trapper move along spaces, encounters adventure or situation generated by pulling cards from a deck.

188930.name: Tue Fourre Marie... et pire encore!
188930.description:
Here's a game for adults who want a big fun in the evening.

A super simple principle: you have 470 characters in the box (men, women , stuff ... , Quebecers , international , fictitious or real ... ) and 124 different actions.

On your turn , you are given 3 characters and 3 actions , sometimes nice , sometimes terrible , sometimes very hot ... You must secretly associate with whom you do what. The other players must guess your choice to score points .

But will you be able to justify yourself ?

Designed in Quebec, developed by Randolph Pub Ludique, Tue Fourre Marie ... et pire encore! will be the perfect end of your gaming evenings with friends , as long as you are not afraid to make choices and horrible laugh .

Tue Fourre Marie... et pire encore! comes with blank cards to customize your game.

Description in French:
Voici un jeu pour les adultes qui veulent une grosse rigolade en soirée.

Un principe super simple : vous avez dans la boite 470 personnages (hommes, femmes, trucs… québécois, internationaux, fictifs ou réels…) et 124 actions différentes.

À votre tour, on pose devant vous 3 personnages et 3 actions, parfois gentilles, parfois horribles, parfois très chaudes… Vous devez secrètement associer à qui vous faites quoi. Les autres joueurs doivent deviner vos choix pour marquer des points.

Mais serez-vous capable de vous justifier ?

Conçu au Québec, développé au Randolph Pub Ludique, Tue Fourre Marie… et pire encore ! sera le jeu idéal de vos fin de soirées entre amis, pour peu que vous n’ayez pas peur de devoir faire des choix horribles et d’en rire.

Tue Fourre Marie… et pire encore ! vient avec des cartes vierges pour personnaliser votre jeu.

188931.name: L’osti d’jeu: Rural
188931.description:
L’osti d’jeu: Rural is the first extension of the popular matching game of crazy ideas! It includes 78 new cards that explore the dark side of the Quebec countryside and all its stereotypes. Use cards such as : "What gives the priest an erection ?" "The Pig Festival of St.-Perpetue" or "Fardoche" to make your games even more wacky!

Description in French:
L’osti d’jeu – Rural est la première extension du populaire jeu d’association d’idées complètement fou! Elle comprend 78 nouvelles cartes qui explorent le côté sombre de la campagne québécoise et tous ses stéréotypes. Utilisez des cartes telles que : « Qu’est-ce qui fait bander le curé? », « Le Festival du Cochon de Ste-Perpétue » ou « Fardoche » pour rendre vos parties encore plus loufoques!

188932.name: Super Star Path
188932.description:
User Summary

Shooting some of these unmoving aliens turns them into gems (that you collect) and some turn into blue crystallized aliens (that you cannot be destroyed). You are searching for a path through the maze of aliens as the board scrolls down. You try to avoid shots from the aliens or any other pointy bits or flames and more importantly, try not to be caught behind anything as the screen scrolls. Either will kill you and the game -- on one death! -- will be over. However, you get to keep the gems you collect and upgrade your ship with better defences, shooting, or mobility. And if you get through the other side of the alien maze you can fight the boss in a typical shoot 'em up bullet hell.

188934.name: Lego Fantasy War
188934.description:
User summary:

The Lego Fantasy War game focuses primarily on miniatures combat, where miniatures are built from Lego blocks and pieces. The game mechanic does allow for individual characters (Human, Dragon, Horse, Monkey, Parrot, Scorpion, Snake, Mummy, Skeleton) with Attributes (Strength and Intelligence), Hit Points, Carrying Capacity, and Movement Points. Additionally, some characters may be Magical (e.g., cast magic spells). Characters may gain experience and advance in power. Character creation is based on Point allocation.

Army creation is based around characters and units. Units are build from blocks with point allocation (e.g., individual blocks are assigned a point purchase cost). The rules govern various units and their capabilities and statistics based upon their actual construction. Combat resolution involves a rather simple mechanic.

188937.name: The Hermetic Factor
188937.description:
From the introduction:

The history of the Order of Hermes is secret by itself; few mortals outside the Order have heard about it, much less about its history.

User summary:

The Hermetic Factor source book for Transcendence presents a blended fantasy and occult genre setting for the game. The book presents a few alternate rules to support the setting, especially dealing with the creation of a "hermetic" character (e.g., an magic user).

188938.name: CYD20 (1st Edition)
188938.description:
From the introduction:

CYD20 provides the necessary background information for a cyberpunk campaign using the d20 system (a trademark of Wizards of the Coast, Inc). CYD20 doesn’t present a complete cyberpunk setting. Rather, it contains all the necessary information for you to stage your own cyberpunk campaigns. Whether you like to play the Neuromancer or Blade Runner, CYD20 will provide you with all the necessary rules and statistics.

From assault rifles to miniguns, combat software to the newest advancements in microprocessor technology, from nerve gas to botulin, cybernetic implants to genetic modifications, from hovercrafts to VTOL aircrafts and ballistic clothing to powered battle armor, CYD20 contains almost everything you’re going to need in your cyberpunk campaign.

188939.name: CYD20 (2nd Edition)
188939.description:
From the introduction:

Ecosystems collapse- deadly new viruses plague humanity – offworld colonies provide a refuge to the wealthy – megacorporations handle the real power in the world – the Interne t virtual reality extends across the globe and the colonies – man fuses with machine, using cybernetic implants and genetic modifications to become superhuman and achieve immortality.

From assault rifles to miniguns, combat software to the latest advancements in microprocessor technology, nerve gas to botulin, cybernetic implants to genetic modifications, from armored cans to VTOL aircrafts and ballistic clothing to powered battle armor, CYD20 contains everything you’re going to need in your cyberpunk campaign.

188940.name: The Rocket Race
188940.description:
Four rockets have a race around the planets, but you have to watch your power in order to get as far as possible. But watch out! As soon as the rockets ar in a certain order you hvae to fire the turbo charger. Who will be the first to reach the end of the universe?

The game is a roll and move game where players roll a custom made dice to move their rocket to try and collect comet rocks from various planets. The winner is the person who ends the game with the most comet rocks.

188941.name: DragonGrace
188941.description:
User summary:

DragonGrace utilized the "Infinity System" as the core mechanic--essentially, a diceless narrative resolution system. The game went through three major iterations, with the third published iteration (confusingly) called version 2. The "Infinity System" was not particularly separated from the game itself.

Characters in the game belonged to a Race (Humans, Short Elves, High Elves, Dwarves, Suarians, Draconians, Half Fae, Catpeople, Merfolk, or Keet) and selected a Class (Fighter, Thief, Magus, or Psionicists). Characters then selected Skills. Skills were grouped according to the base Attribute (Physical, Magical, Psionic, Dexterity, Health, Intelligence, Wisdom) for the Skill. Magical Skills yielded magical spells, and Psionic Skills yielded psionic powers. A special category, Thieving Skills, was restricted. Other Skills were typical for fantasy role-playing.

The game author was identified only as Joe.

188943.name: Freeform
188943.description:
User summary:

Freeform is a diceless, narrative game system that rejects traditional role-playing mechanics in favor of a purely narrative system. The game does not use statistics or other character mechanics, instead relying on narrative tags and group discussion. The bulk of the "rules" presented consist of a series of forum discussions describing methods that have been used successfully in game sessions, as well as noting methods that don't work.

188944.name: ARS: Alternative Roleplaying System
rpg: Fighting Fantasy: The Introductory Role-Playing Game
188944.description:
Advanced Fighting Fantasy 2

User summary:

ARS: Alternative Roleplaying System, presents an alternative core mechanic system that is intended to replace the system used in the commercially published Steve Jackson Games' Fighting Fantasy and Advanced Fighting Fantasy. While much of the original game system is retained, some new Attributes are introduced. The rules provide for conversion.

The variant rules attempt to: shorten and vary combat, and provide a flexible magic system.

188945.name: Reprisal Universe
188945.description:
Help Thallos guide and rescue his people. Using special totem powers you can control nature itself unleashing its full fury on anyone that stands in your way.

As you explore distant lands you must gather your lost tribes and Amulets. But be warned, other tribes may not take too kindly to your intentions and will put up a fight!
Created in homage to Populous, Reprisal's Universe spans over 34 planets and 184 islands pitting you against 3 other tribes - each with their own aggression traits.

Learn to control the 15 totem powers, upgrading them as you explore and harness the 5 Wonder totems for maximum effect. In this Universe you won't be alone, other explorers will be present helping you to uncover items and leaving their own legacies on islands you will explore.

Source: The Developer Website.

188946.name: Keeper's Dissension: Unchained!
188946.description:
Keeper's Dissension is an intense two player strategy game where players battle it out in a Civil War using great warriors, abilities, and resources!
During the game, players will move across the board destroying opposing pieces for loot and board control, while also keeping an eye on available resources that they can use for building defenses and powerful allies!
With a selection of 70 unique Abilities, players can create exciting and engaging effects to pieces, players, or even the entire board, giving the game great dynamics and replay-ability!
In order to win, players must deplete their opponent's LifeForce to 0 while at the same time keeping themself alive!

188947.name: GDR-Game
188947.description: Small quiz game about DDR. The game is just deck of 54 question cards. In every card there is 3 multiple choice questions with 4 choices. On the other side of every card there are answers to questions and small explanations. The game does not include rules how to count points.

188948.name: The Road to Ruin
188948.description:
The Road to Ruin co-operative card and dice game for 1 to 4 players. The Road to Ruin is set in the aftermath of a zombie infection outbreak that has left the city overrun by hordes of unstoppable zombies.

Each player controls a survivor of the outbreak. On their turn, the players move their survivor around hidden locations, revealing each location and the level of zombie threat at that location. Each of the locations is unique, and they may grant the survivor more items or weapons, allow the survivor to scavenge the location for equipment, or might be hazards that block the survivors path. Each of the survivors has a special ability, such as an affinity with a specific type of weapons (melee or ranged), general combat proficiency, extra health, or move versatile movement.

The survivors fight the zombies as they explore each location. In combat, the players roll two six-dice and then use their survivor's weapons and items to attempt to beat the zombie's threat level (which is between 7 and 11). Equipped weapons allow the player to reroll, melee weapons give one reroll and ranged weapons give two rerolls but require matching ammunition. If the survivor fails to fight of the zombie, they are wounded. Each survivor can take on a few wounds before they eliminated. However, survivors can use medical items to remove wounds, and can even discard items in combat to gain more rerolls in a last ditch effort to stay alive.

The goal of the game is to recover multiple supply items and to bring these back to the safe house location before the survivors fall to the zombies. The Road to Ruin comes with four scenarios. The basic scenario 'Supply Run' mentioned above lays out the game's 25 locations in a 5x5 grid and tasks the survivors with recovering six supply items. Other scenarios use different layouts to create varied challenges, including one where the survivors must use a radio at a specific location to call for rescue and then reach the airport location to win. Each of the scenarios also has an easy variation, which usually requires fewer items to be recovered.

188952.name: Maigo-Neko
boardgamepublisher: ばねゲー部(仮) (Spring Games Club.temp)
188952.description:
Pre-Order:Japon Brand
http://japonbrand.myshopify.com/collections/product2016

まいごねこ (Maigoneko) means "stray cats" in English, and in the game, you are a lost cat wondering around town. You initially don't remember what your house looks like, but over the course of the game, you are reminded of characteristics of your house.

Houses have three characteristics: roof color (red, blue, or yellow), stories (single or double), and item in the garden (flowerbed, tree, or fence). In the game, these three are shown on tokens hidden from you. When you reach a house, your neighbor checks your tokens and reveals only one, no matter how many match. This way, you gradually find your unique home. On the way, you also need the kindness of strangers to feed you.

To win, you must identify three characteristics of your house and return to your home before everyone else does. Surely your family will welcome your return heartily!

Publisher's summary:
迷子になった仔猫が自分の家に帰るまでを描いたゲームです。
プレイヤー仔猫になり帰るべき家を思い出して、その家までたどり着くことが目的です。
家は3つの特徴から決まります。
屋根の色（赤色、青色、黄色）、家の形（平屋、二階建て）、庭にある物（花壇、木、柵）。
スタート時点ではそれらの情報は伏せられており、ゲームを進めるうちに少しずつ情報が公開されていきます。
それらの情報を明らかにし、他のプレイヤーより先に家に帰りましょう。
きっと暖かい家族が帰りを待っています!

188954.name: Futures!
188954.description: Futures! is a Japanese game themed around commodity futures. The three resources traded in the game are Corn, Rice, and Pepper. Players aim to finish the game with the most money.

188955.name: World of Warships
videogamehonor: 2014 Gamescom Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2014 PAX Curse Award Best Graphics of the Year Winner
2015 Global Game Awards Best Free-to-Play Game of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
188955.description:
User Summary

A team based naval action game, where teams of up to 12 players fight with Japanese, American, Russian, and German ships with the goal being to destroy the other team while capturing control points. Players can use destroyers, cruisers, battleships, or aircraft carriers. Experience can be gained with each individual ship which can be used to unlock new ships or to unlock upgrades for the current one.

188956.name: Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure
188956.description:
Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure is the ultimate dungeon crawl! It combines true elements of D&D table top roleplaying using ver3.5 Dungeons and Dragons rules with a versatility of a card game dungeon crawl. If you’ve ever played the original computer version of Dungeon Hack and loved the endless possibilities, then this is the game for you. It allows for solo or CO-OP play within a randomly generated multi-level dungeon. Just like in the computer game, you explore a never ending dungeon with monsters, treasure, traps, and glory! It’s you against the dungeon and everyone is out to get you! Dungeon Hack uses actual monsters, traps, treasures and equipment directly from the Dungeon and Dragons universe. Story lines and game play is taken from actual D&D modules! If you’ve wanted to play D&D but couldn’t find the group, well look no further… Dungeon Hack is here! You create actual characters with abilities that you will use during your adventure. All the while you earn experience and fortunes to help level up and grow your character to much stronger and higher levels.

Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure is a solo D&D game on a micro level using 4”x4” tile cards representing dungeon rooms, corridor rooms, corridors and junctions while colored cubes represent your characters and the ever increasing monsters. A multitude of cards depict and define the monsters, treasures, encounters, and obstacles you will face within the dungeon.

Most D&D rules apply, with many of the mundane and complicated rules left out to create a smoother and more stream lined game play.

The goal is to descend each level facing new encounters that will bring you face to face with puzzles, doors, traps, monsters and treasures at every turn. Before every two levels you will have a QUEST card that depicts special requests for the town asking for specific items you can find during your adventures through the levels of the dungeon. If you find or collect all of the items on the QUEST card you receive the stated reward from the town.

Each level of the dungeon you descend will end up providing your character with a level of experience; if you survive to the lowest level of the dungeon, you will have reached the level of hero to be able to challenge the Big Boss!

As you descend deeper into the dungeon you will encounter stronger and more dangerous monsters. When you reach the lowest level you will finally come face to face with the Big Boss of the dungeon which could be a dragon, a demon, etc… basically the challenge of your life!

Survive the dungeon, make it out alive, and you will become the dungeon master! You’re victory score will be based on the level you reach “experience points”, the gold pieces you’ve earned “total gp”, the treasure you’ve accumulated “gp value”, and the monsters you’ve killed “total monsters destroyed”!

188957.name: Journey on the Amazon Game
188957.description:
How wonderful it will be to take a journey down the Amazon with your friends Bromley (parrot fish) and Coltica (parrot). You will learn about the actual animals that live in the Amazon. Along the way, see special places such as Bromley's Flower Garden, the Spectacled Caiman Lodge, Pygmy Owl Singing Classes and the Kapok Hop Dance Camp.

Objective:
Be the first player to move your game peice on the path through the Amazon to the coast.

To play, first you have to construct the gameboard, which is basically a large, 12-piece floor jigsaw puzzle that measures 20" x 30" when put together. Once the board is constructed, it displays a winding path through the jungle or Amazon. Over a dozen animals specific to the region featured are included several times on the game spaces that make up the path. A deck of cards featuring the animals is included and players take turns drawing cards and moving to the animal shown. The first player to reach the end of the path, wins!

Extra cards add even more fun to the game like certain animals that make you move back spaces, short cut cards, quick sand (lose turn) cards, Piranha cards (switch places with another player), and more.

The instruction booklet includes a bit of info on each animal on the board and cards, so kids can even learn a bit while playing this game. Cards include labels of the animal names in both English and Spanish. For 2-6 players.

188958.name: Bugs 'n' Slugs
188958.description:
Race to the finish by correctly answering questions about all those creepy crawly little critters! How long can a cockroach live with its head cut off? How many mosquitoes can a dragonfly eat in one day? The questions are multiple choice or true/false, so even if you don't know the answer, you have a chance of getting it right and learn something along the way! Most of the spaces are question spaces, but some spaces challenge players to complete an activity. For instance, without using your hands or feet, wriggle across the floor like a worm, then ask other players to guess what you are" (which may be awkward if adults are playing the game, but kids would probably find it enjoyable!). Fun and educational, you'll gather a wealth of knowledge about bugs and slugs by the time you reach the end!

The objective of the game is to be the first to cross the finish line.

188959.name: Rebellious Archetypes Volume V
188959.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a Rebel with a Cause!

Not every evil lurks in deep, dark dungeons far away from innocent townsfolk, waiting patiently for adventurers to kick down their doors and start fighting. Some monsters don't just prey on society from without, but have burrowed and wormed their way into the very heart of the civilized world, and twist and corrupt the very laws that are supposed to protect the innocent, using them to oppress and exploit them, instead. These evils are no less a threat than the ones that most adventurers face, but many PCs are ill-equipped to deal with them. This is a job for rebels.

This book presents five new rebellious archetypes for five different classes. Included are the revolution’s fury, a barbarian archetype whose righteous rage serves as a beacon to her allies, rallying them behind her cause, the wild blaster, a kineticist archetype capable of great surges of energy, but who lacks staying power, forcing them to use hit-and-run guerilla tactics, the keeper of the revolution, an occultist archetype that specializes in concealing people and things, and who can gather information through psychic contacts, the prophet of the revolution, an oracle archetype cursed with an aura in which blood flows more freely, and who experiences visions that can empower herself and her allies against tyranny, and the guerilla skirmisher, a rogue archetype that focuses on hit-and-run tactics and is even more slippery and evasive than other rogues.

Whether you're about to embark on a politically-themed campaign (such as the official Paizo adventure path focusing on revolution), or you just want a selection of exciting new abilities for passionate and freedom-loving PCs, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for rebellious villains as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

188960.name: Yaddrin
188960.description:
From the introduction:

Yaddrin is a shared Fantasy role playing world using the Dark Dungeon game system.

User summary:

Yaddrin is used as a shared world be numerous groups of gamers, primarily in the Netherlands, but also form the USA, Sweden, and Germany. The world has been in development since 1989. Through 2003 it was made available in HTML format on a paid subscription basis.

188961.name: Explorers of the Mind: Psionics
188961.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Third Eye

“Romain snapped back to reality. “We know we’ve pushed our luck for weeks now. But I so far am not hearing a better suggestion. And, Zsofia, the one you’re thinking right now is no good either.”

“Oh?” asked Zsofia. The lighter floated across the card table and into her hand. She lit an old-school cigarette, the kind that actually burned. “And why is that?”

“Because we don’t know that Division 6 even exists,” replied Romain, taking a calming swig from his flask.”

The Void is an original Lovecraftian hard sci-fi horror setting.

Explorers of the Mind: Psionics:

Introduces optional rules for using psionics in your game and creating psion Characters.
Provides rules for the five major types of psychic abilities.
Gives advice for GMs who wish to integrate psionics into their games.

188962.name: White Box Chivalry: Accolades & Knighthood
188962.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Lord and Land

White Box Chivalry provides optional rules for Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox which allow any character, regardless of race or class to earn their place as knights of the realm. Whether a wandering Knight Errant or devlish Blackguard, your character can learn the to wield sword and shield in defense of their liege lord and those bound to the land.

188963.name: Tree Maze of the Twisted Druid
188963.description:
From publisher blurb:

Straight from the garage of Chris's mom — and 1981 — comes this homegrown, truly old school adventure of malign druids, twisted tree demons, evil blink dogs, arboreal gelatinous cubes, magical pecans and certain death.

Though sadly missing half its original key, the release has been painstakingly recreated by the author as a grown man. More or less.

188964.name: Victims of the Demon Lord: Starter Guide
188964.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fodder for the Demon Lord!

The perfect introduction to Shadow of the Demon Lord, this supplement provides you with everything you need to create a starting character for the game. Gathering up the first two chapters of the highly anticipated horror fantasy roleplaying, this product is aimed at helping new players create characters quickly and to give you a slim reference guide for when you play the game.

188965.name: VCS Kharkov: Spring Prelude, May 1942
188965.description:
This is a VCS version of the Second Battle of Kharkov, 12-27 May 1942. Second volume of Nathan's VCS series of wargames started with his title, Salerno.

This is a simulation of the failed Soviet offensive to recapture Kharkov and the subsequent German attack which produced the last great pocket of Soviet prisoners during the spring of 1942. Players will conduct operations as either Soviet Direction Commander Timoshenko or the German commander of Army Group South, von Bock.

This game is primarily based on Kharkov 1942: Anatomy of a Military Disaster by David Glantz with some OOB fleshing by Nafziger and maps based on post-war USGS surveys (which were themselves taken from wartime Soviet surveys). Overall goal is to be about equal to or less than the complexity in Salerno.

Details are for now:

Two 22"x34" maps (total area 44"x36") at 3 miles/hex and one day per turn. Counters are two and a half sheets at 1/2" for a total of 700, including over 350 actual units, mainly German regiments and Soviet divisions.

188966.name: Confrontation
188966.description:
In Confrontation, players choose between being members of the student protesters and Establishment teams. The latter is broken down into ten subgroups, including the military, Washington, city hall, the university administration, etc.

The goal of the Establishment theme is to keep things the way they are. The students will use peaceful protests, strikes and riots to change society for the better.

The game consists of 11 team cards, 4 results charts (effectively CRTs), 16 confrontation cards, 18 student tokens, 6 police tokens, and 36 Establishment resources tokens. Each side debates the issue at hand, commits resources to confrontation, then consults the results chart to see who wins.

188967.name: Faerie Fire
188967.description:
User summary:

Faerie Fire was the only published genre source book for the GRS: General Roleplaying System. Characters in Faerie Fire vary from the base system in some details. Characters have Attributes (Strength, Intelligence, Charisma, Stamina, and Dexterity) with numeric values distributed from a point pool. Characters have standard Skills (Occult, Brawl, Dodge, Common Sense, Martial Arts, and Resources) with number values distributed from a second point pool. The characters are all assumed to be fae (fairies) hiding among humanity. All fae can create magical effects (cast spells).

The action resolution system uses a stripped pack of playing cards, as in the core system. Combat is resolved in the same way.

188968.description:
From the rulebook:

Dark times have fallen over the kingdom of Baconia, the mythical kingdom where bacon grows on trees. Beloved and powerful Queen Angie O'Plasty has died and left no heir, leaving the barons competing for supremacy.

In Bacon Wars, you are a baron(ess) vying for dominance over Baconia in the power vacuum the Queen left. Can you be the baron that seizes control over the delicious land?

Each player control bacon orchards and uses bacon strips (yielded in part by those orchards) to play cards. Cards come in several different types and require different bacon costs be paid in order to be played. Players take turns drawing cards and spending bacon to play them until there is a winner.

To win, a player must either:
A) be the only player with any orchards left, or
B) have two level 3 orchards at the beginning of his or her turn.
188968.name: Bacon Wars

188969.name: The Avengers
188969.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Initially planned as a third-person action adventure, the game’s narrative was entirely unrelated to the film and, penned by Brian Michael Bendis, saw The Avengers contend with a Skrull invasion led by an enormous mother ship. Spider-Woman was to play a side role, although would later be revealed as Skrull Empire queen Veranke in disguise after intense interrogated by SHIELD’s Nick Fury.

188970.name: Project Evo
188970.description:
User summary:

The HTML documents provide a complete game system and a fully developed setting which presents a cyberpunk/post-holocaust earth with several types of advanced humans produced by genetic manipulation. Characters generate Attributes and Derived Attributes, then select a Profession (Class) that permits access to certain capabilities. The game supports extensive equipment, vehicle, and item types including biological implants. The setting provides background on several cities, corporations, and factions.

In addition, the game site presents a lengthy design document (interesting but not needed for play) and a demo game transcript. Most of the site is formatted into a downloadable DOC formatted document.

188972.description:
From the box:

BEDLAM EULA: This is a personal project from an employee. By opening this box, you acknowledge that this game is not designed, licensed or intended for use in the design, construction, operation or maintenance of any nuclear facility. You should also probably have a sense of humor, like ninjacats, love this company and enjoy working here but still enjoy some good-natured poking fun at ourselves, find transcendenant joy in reading EULAs and typing in 6 character PINS to access your email, like reading long, comma-separated sentences, and will not hold said employee or anyone else responsible if your delicate sensitivities are troubled by the occasional swear word or crass humor that may or may not be inside this box.

In other words, this is a Microsoft-themed set of cards for Cards Against Humanity style play.
188972.name: Bedlam: AKA The "Can Someone Take Me Off this Game?" Game

188973.name: Entalis
188973.description:
User summary:

Entalis, Reality Prime, is a science-fiction game core system and setting. The setting features numerous worlds that are accessible through a sort of hyper-space network of conduits. Characters are generated by selecting a Race (Human, Anarian, Omegan, Survivalist, or Kuldorian), a background and starting Occupation (roughly analogous to Class), and then generating Attributes randomly. Roughly half of the Attributes are rated on a scale of 1 through about 20; the other half are rated on a percentile scale. Characters then select Skills available to their Occupation and purchase equipment.

The PDF version is downloadable as a series of files corresponding to the major HTML pages.

188974.name: Imperial Harvest: Broomstick Monkey
188974.description:
User Summary
Broomstick Monkey is a promotional character card for the game Imperial Harvest. The character is based on the publisher's mascot of the same name and was included as a bonus with the Kickstarter edition of the game. The Broomstick Monkey may fly over hedges and, in the advanced game, is not affected by ranged attacks. While carrying a strawberry, the Broomstick Monkey may carry any number of items.

188975.name: Eis & Dampf
188975.description:
User summary

A German steampunk setting for FATE Core which is based on a German novel series. Its setting is an alternate history version of Europe that is locked in an Ice Age in the 19th century.

188976.name: Zeg geen Ja, Zeg geen Nee Party Editie
188976.description:
Players have to answer questions as quickly as possible but are not allowed to say Yes or No (Ja or Nee in Dutch). There is a timer. When all questions on a card have been answered without Yes or No, the player can keep the card. When the time is over, the next player can attempt to earn as many cards as possible within the time available.
The player who finishes with the most cards wins.

188977.name: Zeg geen Ja, Zeg geen Nee
188977.description:
Players have to answer questions as quickly as possible but are not allowed to say Yes or No (Ja or Nee in Dutch). There is a timer. When all questions on a card have been answered without Yes or No, the player can keep the card. When the time is over, the next player can attempt to earn as many cards as possible within the time available.
The player who finishes with the most cards wins.

188978.name: Unter Wölfen
188978.description:
[User summary:]
Anthology with three adventures for Splittermond:
- "Gejagt!", set in Mertalia. The characters have to find a gnome who went missing - and stumble upon a dark cult while doing so.
- "Ein Funke Mut", set in Midstad. The characters find themselves between the factions of the Midstad civil war and have to decide whether they want to help the freedom fighters against the tyrant Finn von Harreburg.
- "Das Heulen des Windes", set in Wintholt. The characters have to help a remote village that is being attacked by Vargs - and find out, what the wolfpeople want from the villagers.

188979.name: Escape From Lunar 7
188979.description:
A cooperative game of survival.

Your lunar prospecting mission has gone horribly wrong! Aliens have arrived and destroyed your ship and are attacking the lunar bases. You have evaded them for now, but need to get back to Earth. You head to Lunar 7, an old abandoned lunar base, hoping to find a still working ship.

Just as you all manage to reach the landing pad and start moving into the base, the Alien ship finds you. It begins dropping aliens all over the base trying to find and prevent you from escaping. Now you must find the supplies you need to repair your ship and escape, all while trying to hold off the ever growing hoard of aliens.

Game is played as a cooperative game, with everyone helping to make sure all of you escape.

Basic game play: Each turn you have 3 action points which you use to move and explore (placing tiles), picking up and dropping off resources (energy cells) to power factory tiles that build repair parts. You collect the parts and take them back to your ship to repair it and escape the aliens. At the end of each turn you will draw an Alien card that tells which tile an alien lands on. When moving to a tile with aliens the player 'pushes' the aliens off that tile onto surrounding tiles. Anytime a tile has 4 or more aliens, the aliens destroy that tile (flip it over) and scatter to the adjacent tiles. This can lead to chain reaction where one tile being destroyed causes more tiles to be overloaded with aliens and destroyed.

188980.name: Mysterium Magnus: New Occultist Options
188980.description:
From publisher blurb:

Students of forbidden lore, occultists search for secret power purposely hidden from mortal eyes. Some even seek out the hideous and vile mysteries shunned by the sane.

Herein are over two dozen new horrific options for the occultist class, from new archetypes to new spine-tingling focus powers.

188981.name: Spud Head: The Card Game
188981.description:
Winner of the October 2015 24-Hour Game Design Challenge! Printed copies will eventually be made available, in the mean time enjoy this PnP version.

The object of the game is to create potato heads, earning points. A complete head consists of one eye card (top of head), one mouth/nose card (bottom card) and two ear cards. You can get bonus points if you are able to complete your head with a hat, feet and/or a item (see final scoring).

Setup:
Shuffle all the cards. Deal out seven cards to each player. Place remaining cards in the middle of the table as a draw deck, leaving space for a discard pile. Determine the first player, and play will continue clockwise.

Game Play:
On a turn, players draw one card, either from the draw deck or the top card of the discard pile. If they have collected enough head parts to complete a head (with or without the bonus cards), they may place the assembled head face-up in front of them.

Once a head it is played on the table, no cards can be added to it or any of its cards changed. At the end of a players turn; if they have more than seven cards, they must discard down to seven cards.

The numbers in the upper corner of the ear cards help determine if the ears are matching and if the are right side up - as it is possible to use a left ear upside down to finish a head.

Play continues until all the cards from the draw deck and discard deck are empty; or until no player can complete any additional potato heads. Then using the scoring table below, add up all the points for each player and determine a winner.

In case of a tie, the player who has used the most bonus cards is the winner. And if still a tie, the player who was able to use the most item cards wins. After that it is a shared victory of Spud Heads!

Final Scoring:

+ 10 Points Each complete Spud Head

+5 Points With matching ears

+ 15 Points With hat, feet and matching item for hat

+5 Points With hat and feet

+ 2 Points With hat or feet

-2 Points For each ear placed upside down

188982.description:
This is compilation of 3 games + puzzle.

Delfinarium is a water polo game between seals and dolphins. Players move figurines of seals and dolphins and push figurine of ball in order to score a goal. The winner is player who scores more goals.

Svet tišine is educational game. While playing children can learn about classification of sea animals. Players move figurines and collect counters by stopping on the field next to counter. The winner is the player who collects the most counters.

Trka puževa (Race of snails) is a simple game for younger players. Board has 3D elements. Each player has one figurine of a snail. They race along sea bed. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow them down. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.
188982.name: Akvateka 3+1

188983.name: Luna Park Keys
188983.description:
The 6 friends know that the guard has fallen asleep. They will sneak inside the Fun Park. They will run as fast as they can.
Who is going to unlock the more games?
Who is going to be the winner of the day?
Who is going to find the more Luna Park Keys?

The players move across the terrain by rolling the dice. They have to find the keys that shows which game they unlock by picking a "games" card. Now they have to go and unlock the game to win the "Trophy" card. The player with the more Trophy cards when all games are unlocked is the winner of the game. Be careful, because your keys and Trophies are in danger. If a "friend" steps on your tile can take from you either a key or all your trophies!!!
The game has an augmented reality app that allows players to see the Luna Park games come to life. Also, when a player wins a "Trophy" card, he/she can see an extra prize through the app.
(The app is not necessary to play the game)

Description in Greek:
Όπως κάθε μέρα, έτσι και σήμερα, αυτή την ώρα τα παιδιά γνωρίζουν ότι ο φύλακας θα κοιμάται και θα μπορέσουν να παίξουν χωρίς να το καταλάβει. Θα τρέξουν, όλα, όσο πιο γρήγορα μπορούν.
Θα διαγωνιστούν στο ποιός θα φτάσει πρώτος.
Άραγε ποιός θα είναι σήμερα ο νικητής;
Ποιός θα είναι αυτός που θα παίξει τα πιο πολλά παιχνίδια;
Ποιός θα καταφέρει να μαζέψει τα περισσότερα
Κλειδιά Του Λούνα-Παρκ ???
Οι παίκτες καλούνται να βρουν τα κλειδιά που έχει σκορπίσει ο φύλακας στο χώρο του Λούνα Παρκ. Να τραβήξουν μία κάρτα ώστε να βρουν ποιανού παιχνιδιού το κλειδι βρήκαν και στη συνέχεια να κατευθυνθούν ρίχνοντας το ζάρι προς την κλειδαριά του παιχνιδιού. Όταν φτάσουν στην κλειδαριά χρησιμοποιούν το κλειδί ώστε να παίξουν το παιχνίδι και κερδίζουν μία κάρτα τρόπαια. Μόνο ένα κλειδί μπορεί να κρατάει ο ΄καθε παίχτης μέχρι να ξεκλειδώσει το εν λόγω παιχνίδι. Στόχος να ξεκλειδώσεις όσο πιο πολλά παιχνίδια μπορείς και να κερδίσεις τα περισσότερα τρόπαια. Προσοχή διότι οι φίλοι σου μπορούν να σου κλέψουν κλειδιά και τρόπαια αν βρεθείς στο δρόμο τους!!!

188984.name: Monopoly: Arizona edition
188984.description: The dramatic landscape, extraordinary ancient artifacts, unusual wildlife and phenomenal wonders of nature form the backdrop of "The Grand Canyon State". The Monopoly Brand proudly introduces a game for everyone who treasures America's 48th state.

188985.name: Presidente
188985.description:
Presidente is a quick, fun game where the smartest presidential candidate wins. It puts the player in the role of one of the candidates , who will do anything to win this presidential election, including using various dirty tactics against his opponents. Luckily, the victims can use the newspapers they own to spread the truth and walk away clean.

Not everything has to be achieved by cheating. You can also win elections cleanly, working honestly, achieving an impeccable political career, performing marches and other activities.

Instructions: Every player has a hand of 5 cards, which he replenishes from the deck after every play. On his turn he will play one of the cards in his hand. Usually he will play them in his own tableaux in one of three piles, votes (orange), money (green) and influence (purple). The person with the most votes at the end of the game is the winner, but you will need money and influence to be able to play the cards with the most votes. Sadly, the cards representing the strongest money and influence have the whiff of corruption about them, and if an opponent sees corruption in your tableaux, he can use the press to strip you of said money/influence.

Game ends when all cards have been played.

188987.description:
From the FFG Announcement Article:

Each Maneuver Dial Upgrade Kit provides three sculpted plastic dials that proudly display the affiliation of your current squadron with one of the three X-Wing factions. To use one of these plastic maneuver dials, simply take the cardboard dial token showing a ship’s maneuvers and insert it into the secure plastic housing. Once situated, you can place the plastic maneuver selection marker into place, and you’re ready to fly your ship with style.

In addition, these plastic maneuver dials provide an easy way for you to differentiate between your dials at a glance. Each maneuver dial includes a space on the back for you to insert a dial ID token that displays a silhouette of the corresponding ship. A pack of maneuver dials includes three dial ID tokens for every ship from the T-65 X-wing and TIE Fighter in the original X-Wing Core Set, up to the T-70 X-wing and TIE/fo fighter from Star Wars: The Force Awakens™ Core Set!

Soon, every X-Wing expansion will include a dial ID token for you to use with your plastic maneuver dials if you so choose. These will begin with the Ghost Expansion Pack, the Mist Hunter Expansion Pack, the Punishing One Expansion Pack, and the Inquisitor’s TIE Expansion Pack. Standard cardboard maneuver dials will still be included in each expansion.
boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set
188987.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Maneuver Dial Upgrade Kit

188988.description:
The Far Space Foundry: Extra Products Expansion provides 6 additional products to be manufactured and shipped out from Space Foundry Beta (the second half of a game of Far Space Foundry). Some of the new products require a credit to purchase them, and the mechs are so heavy that they require twice as much thrust to transport them!

This was included as a free stretch goal in the initial Kickstarter campaign for Far Space Foundry, but very likely will be available for purchase later.

Components

6 Product cards
36 Product tokens
1 instruction card
188988.name: Far Space Foundry: Extra Products Expansion

188989.description:
Extra Pilots: An Expansion for Far Space Foundry provides 6 additional neutral pilots for Far Space Foundry. These neutral pilots count as a "wild" faction; they'll go with any freighter. Each pilot has its own ability.

This was included as a free stretch goal in the initial Kickstarter campaign for Far Space Foundry, but very likely will be available for purchase later.

Components

6 neutral (white) Alien Pilot cards
2 instruction cards




Neutral Pilot Abilities

Mercenary — Whenever you use this pilot, you may bribe the dock master for free.
Miner — Whenever you use this pilot, you may take 1 ore from the supply.
Pirate — Whenever you use this pilot, you may move any number of items from one of your freighters to your others.
Scavenger — Whenever you use this pilot, you may use the ability of any one alien in your discard.
Specialist — Whenever you use this pilot, you may take the docking bay action twice.
Thief — Whenever you use this pilot, you may take 1 credit from the supply.
188989.name: Extra Pilots: An Expansion for Far Space Foundry

188991.description:
Welcome to the highly lucrative world of intergalactic real-estate! In Alienation, you will assume the role of a real-estate agent attempting to satisfy various alien creature clientele. But watch out for your rival competitors, because they will surely be trying to corner the market. Finish with the most points after 3 rounds to win the game!

Players will draft a hand of 9 alien creature cards. Creature cards may have 1, 2, or 3 creatures displayed in one of 6 races: Friendlies, Meanies, Rowdies, Sleepies, Matchies, and Sunnies. Each race has very distinct personalities and interacts differently with their neighbors. On his/her turn, the starting player will take one of 2 actions:

1. Play 1 card in his/her own solar system.
2. Play 1 card in another player’s solar system.

All cards must be played either adjacent or diagonal to the sun card. Play proceeds left. The next player then takes one of the 2 actions. Once your solar system has 8 creature cards surrounding the sun, it is full. You may now ONLY play cards in other players’ solar systems. The round ends once all solar systems are filled. The final card in each player’s hand is placed into the discard pile. Each player will now score his/her solar system.
188991.name: Alienation
boardgamepodcastepisode: OrcaCon and the Games of 2016

188992.name: Der letzte Tyrann
188992.description:
[User summary:]
Solitaire adventure/gamebook about a journey from a doomed man to a ruler. Has many parallels to the legend of Herakles.

188993.name: Stein der Götter
188993.description:
[User summary:]
Adventure about a gold rush in a mining town in the Empire of Myranor and the many factions looking for profit there.

188994.name: Legatin des Bösen
188994.description:
[User summary:]
Solitaire adventure in which the player does not play an own hero, but rather a well-known NPC from the world of Das Schwarze Auge: The evil elf Pardona.

188995.name: Solitaire Survival
188995.description:
You are stranded in the wilderness and must gather resources and craft items in order to survive while maintaining your health and food levels.

On a turn, you perform one action (claim resources, craft item, or rest) then roll the die to see which event impacts you. You win if you craft all 5 survival items. You lose if your health or food drops to zero.

This is a postcard game. The board is printed on an oversized postcard. 12 small tokens and a d6 are not included and are required to play.

188996.description:
Koram, der Gor-Häuptling is a single-card expansion for Legends of Andor, offered at the Lucca Comics & Games Festival in 2015, which may be used with legends 2-5 or The Star Shield.

At the beginning of the game, one gor is given a black base; this is Koram. The card is placed on the legend track by rolling a six-sided die. When the narrator reaches this space (and after any other tokens or cards on that space are activated) Koram is placed by rolling two six-sided dice for the 10s and 1s digit. As long as Koram is on the board all gors have six strength and give four gold/WP as a reward. Koram moves as usual for a gor, and should he reach space 0, this effect lasts until the end of the legend.
188996.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Koram, der Gor-Häuptling
boardgameexpansion: Legends of Andor: The Star Shield

188997.name: Piratas!
188997.description:
Seeking wealth and treasures, pirates are capable of doing everything. In Piratas! you're a captain of a pirate ship and must gather enough treasure before your opponents, even if that requires robbing, pillaging and fighting!

The first to collect 5 treasures and succeed in not being robbed will be acknowledged as the great legend of the 7 seas.

During the turn, the player can take 2 actions, which are: playing a card and using its ability, buying a card from the deck or declaring a duel with another player.

If a player chooses to duel with another one, they need to choose the amount of cannons they will use and the corresponding fired cannonballs, with the winner killing all the opponent's pirates and getting to see and pick one card from the loser's hand.

Other card actions include stealing treasures, having a parrot to copy the action of another player, pillaging, fleeing from combat or even drowning another player's pirate!

188998.name: Harry Potter: The Roleplaying Game
188998.description:
User summary:

Harry Potter: The Roleplaying Game adapts the series of Harry Potter novels to tabletop role-playing. Characters are students at Hogwart's school. Characters have Attributes (Strength, Vitality, Nimbleness, Perception, Bearing, Intellect, and Magic) which have numeric values that are either randomly generated by 2D6 or assigned from a standard matrix (10, 9, 7, 7, 5, and 4). Characters also have several Secondary Attributes which are derived values. Characters next select a Heritage (Muggle, Muggle-born, Half-Muggle, Pureblood, or Non-magical Wizard/Squib), join a Wizard House, and select Skills. Skills are placed in Skill Groups and Skills also allow for Specialization (sub-categories within a Skill). Character creation completes with the assignment of Traits (either Edges or Flaws - or both). Magical characters will also select Abilities, roughly analogous to spell abilities.

Action resolution pits 2D6 plus modifiers against a Target Number. Routine tasks have a Target Number of 5; Impossible tasks have a Target Number of 25. Modifiers are either situational or based on innate Skill or Ability. Combat functions similarly but uses a wide variety of special maneuvers and situations.

188999.name: The Game of Full Barn
188999.description:
The game comes with 12 different cards, four of each kind. Players attempt to collect a "full barn" of items, animals and characters getting one of each card. Player's pick cards, trade cards, and ask others for cards to add to their collection. The "Ol' Rat" card lets a player steal a card from a another player's barn.

The game comes in a small drawstring bag with no year information. Designed and illustrated Josiah Hurst, age 15.
